recipes.title: Antipasto on a Stick
recipes.directions: Thread on skewer.  Place in pan.  Top with Italian dressing.    Refrigerate overnight.

recipes.title: Ants on a Log
recipes.directions: Spread peanut butter on celery. Dot raisins on peanut butter and serve.

recipes.title: Apple and Cheddar Sandwiches
recipes.directions: Toss apple slices with lemon juice,  set aside.    Cut each slice of date-nut bread in half.  Top each piece of bread with a slice of cheese, a slice of apple and a dollop of apple chutney.        Apple Chutney :  Buy chunky cinnamon applesauce and mix with raisins.

recipes.title: Apple-Nut Fruit Dip
recipes.directions: Beat cream cheese and apple juice until smooth.    Cover and chill.    At serving time sprinkle with pecans.    Serve with apple wedges, pear wedges, pineapple spears, strawberries

recipes.title: Artichoke Appetizer Squares
recipes.directions: Unroll dough into long rectangle in ungreased 9x130x22 pan.  Seal perforations.  Press over bottom and 1/20x22 up sides to form crust.    Sprinkle with parmesan cheese.  Bake at 375 for 5 minutes.    In small bowl beat cream cheese until smooth.    Add sour cream, dill, salt and egg,  Blend well.    Spread over partially baked crust.    Top with remaining ingredients.    Return to oven and bake and additional 13 - 19 minutes or until edges are deep golden brown and center is set.      To serve cut into squares.  Serve warm or cold.  Store in refrigerator.

recipes.title: Artichoke Dip
recipes.directions: Mix all ingredients.    Bake at 350 for 25 -30 minutes.        Do not use microwave.

recipes.title: Baked Apple Cookies
recipes.directions: With serrated knife, cut the Brie horizontally in half.  Sprinkle the bottom half with chopped parsley and tomatoes.  Replace top half of Brie,  set aside.    Grease a cookie sheet.    Brush 1 sheet of phyllo with butter.  Place Brie in center of phyllo.  Wrap Brie with phyllo, pressing phyllo against Brie.  Brush another sheet of phyllo with butter.  Turn Brie over and place in center of sheet.  Wrap as with first sheet.  Repeat with 2 more sheets of phyllo, turning Brie over each time.    Place remaining 4 sheets of phyllo on work surface, overlapping edges to measure 240x22 x 220x22.  Brush with butter.  Place Brie in center of phyllo.  Bring side of phyllo up over Brie to cover completely, bunching edges together to form a ruffled bow on top of packet,  brush with remaining butter.  Secure ruffle with toothpicks, if necessary.    Bake at 375 degrees for 30 - 35 minutes.  Cover with foil during last 15 minutes.    Place baked Brie in refrigerator about 1 hour or until Brie is room temperature.  Or, if made early in day, keep Brie refrigerated and remove 2 hours before serving and let stand at room temperature.    To serve, arrange Brie, crackers, grapes, and dried fruit on large platter.

recipes.title: Baked Brie
recipes.directions: With serrated knife, cut the Brie horizontally in half.  Sprinkle the bottom half with chopped parsley and tomatoes.  Replace top half of Brie,  set aside.    Grease a cookie sheet.    Brush 1 sheet of phyllo with butter.  Place Brie in center of phyllo.  Wrap Brie with phyllo, pressing phyllo against Brie.  Brush another sheet of phyllo with butter.  Turn Brie over and place in center of sheet.  Wrap as with first sheet.  Repeat with 2 more sheets of phyllo, turning Brie over each time.    Place remaining 4 sheets of phyllo on work surface, overlapping edges to measure 240x22 x 220x22.  Brush with butter.  Place Brie in center of phyllo.  Bring side of phyllo up over Brie to cover completely, bunching edges together to form a ruffled bow on top of packet,  brush with remaining butter.  Secure ruffle with toothpicks, if necessary.    Bake at 375 degrees for 30 - 35 minutes.  Cover with foil during last 15 minutes.    Place baked Brie in refrigerator about 1 hour or until Brie is room temperature.  Or, if made early in day, keep Brie refrigerated and remove 2 hours before serving and let stand at room temperature.    To serve, arrange Brie, crackers, grapes, and dried fruit on large platter.

recipes.title: Baked Goat Cheese and Salsa
recipes.directions: Combine cheeses and mix well.    Place in center of pie plate.    Spoon salsa around and on top of cheese.    Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes.    Serve with crackers, bread or tortilla chips.

recipes.title: Brie en Croute
recipes.directions: Place wheel of brie in center of puff pastry.    Cover brie with apricot preserves and pecans.    Gather pastry on top of cheese and tie with cotton twine.    Place on lightly greased cookie sheet and refrigerate for 1 hour.    Brush dough with egg yolk.    Bake at 400 degrees for 25-30 minutes.

recipes.title: Bruschetta
recipes.directions: For olive paste :  Combine olives, vinegar, garlic, capers, and 1 tsp. olive oil in food processor bowl.  Cover and blend till smooth paste forms.  (Can be kept in airtight container and chilled for 2 days.        For tomato topping :  Stir together tomatoes, green onion, 1 tbs. olive oil, basil, and pepper.  (Can be kept in refrigerator for 2 days.)        For toast :  Cut bread into 1/2 inch slices.  Brush both sides with olive oil.  Place slices in a single layer on an ungreased baking sheet.        Bake slices in a 425 degree oven for 5 minutes or till crisp and lightly browned, turning once.        To assemble :  Spread each piece of toast with a thin layer of olive paste.  Top each with about 2 tbs. of tomato topping.  Sprinkle with cheese.  Return to ungreased cookie sheet.        Bake in a 425 degree oven for 2 - 3 minutes or till cheese starts to melt and toppings are heated through.  Serve warm.

recipes.title: Buffalo Wings
recipes.directions: Melt butter with Louisiana hot sauce.    Fry chicken wings for 15 minutes.    Dip wings in hot sauce.        In blender, mix bleu cheese, heavy cream, sour cream and vinegar.

recipes.title: Chex Party Mix
recipes.directions: Melt butter.  Stir garlic salt and worcestershire sauce into butter.    Mix cereals, pretzels and nuts and coat with sauce.    Microwave on high for 6 minutes.  Stir every 2 minutes.        (Can be baked at 350 for 20 - 25 minutes.)

recipes.title: Egg Nog Dip
recipes.directions: Cook eggnog and cornstarch until thick and bubbly.    Cook and stir 2 minutes more.    Remove from heat, cover surface with plastic wrap, and cool.    Beat heavy cream and sugar.     Fold heavy cream, sour cream and rum into eggnog.    Chill, covered, overnight.    Serve with fruit or pound cake.

recipes.title: Garlic Crab Artichoke Dip
recipes.directions: Combine all ingredients in a 1 1/2 qt. casserole dish.    Mix well.    Bake, uncovered, at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.    Serve with crackers or bagel chips.

recipes.title: Golden Apple Half-Moons
recipes.directions: Cut each apple into 24 slices with peel.    Toss with lemon juice.    Cut ham into 1-20x22 strips.    Cut chives into 30x22 lengths.        Prepare honey-mustard mayo :  Mix 2/3 cup mayo,  2 tsp.honey mustard and 4 tsp. minced scallions.        To assemble : Spread mayo on one side of ham strip.  Place 2 chive pieces on top of each apple slice and wrap a ham strip around middle of each slice.  Cover and refrigerate. May be made 2-3 hours ahead.

recipes.title: Ham-It-Up Crescent Snacks
recipes.directions: Unroll dough into 4 large rectangles.    Press and seal perforations.    Place a slice of ham on each rectangle.    Spread with mustard.    Sprinkle with cheese.    Roll up from short end.    Coat rolls with sesame seeds.    Cut each roll into 5 slices.    Place on ungreased cookie sheet.    Bake at 375 for 15 - 20 minutes.

recipes.title: Herb Cheese Crescents
recipes.directions: Unroll dough into 8 triangles.    Cut each triangle in half lengthwise.    Spread 1 tsp. of cheese of each triangle.    Roll up from wide end.    Place on ungreased cookie sheet.    Bake at 375 for 10 - 12 minutes.

recipes.title: Hidden Valley Cheese Fingers
recipes.directions: Cut bread lengthwise.    Mix cream cheese and salad dressing.    Spread on bread.    Add toppings.    Broil until bubbly.    Slice in 1 inch fingers.

recipes.title: Italian Easter Pie
recipes.directions: Stir sugar and cinnamon into ricotta.    Blend in 3 eggs.    Divide filling into 2 pie shells.    Top each with sliced egg and pepperoni.    Top with pie crust.    Cover edges of pie with aluminum foil.    Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.    Remove aluminum foil and bake 15 minutes more.        Chill and serve cool.

recipes.title: Mini Reubens
recipes.directions: Mix cheese, corned beef, dressing and sauerkraut.      Spread over each slice of bread.    Place on ungreased cookie sheet and broil for 2 - 3 minutes or until golden.      Cut each pickle in half lengthwise.    Top with 2 pickle halves.

recipes.title: Mozzarella and Ham Kabobs
recipes.directions: Mix together olive oil, salt, pepper, oregano, basil, and crushed red pepper.  Add mozzarella, tossing to coat well.  Cover and refrigerate several hours or overnight.    Cut roasted peppers in 10x22 pieces.  On tooth pick, thread 1 piece of pepper, 1 piece of mozzarella, and a piece of prosciutto.    Cover and refrigerate if not serving right away.

recipes.title: Peaches and Brie Quesadillas
recipes.directions: Combine honey and lime juice.        Combine peaches, chives and brown sugar.    Arrange brie on half of tortilla.  Top with peaches.  Fold tortilla in half.    Heat frying pan over medium-high heat.  Coat with Pam.    Brown tortilla and cut into pieces.        Serve with sauce.

recipes.title: Pickle Roll-Ups
recipes.directions: Spread 1 side of ham with cream cheese.    Place pickle on ham and roll up.    Cover and refrigerate 1 hour.    Cut into slices.

recipes.title: Reuben Dip
recipes.directions: Mix all ingredients except rye bread.        Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes.        Serve with rye bread.

recipes.title: Reuben Potato Skins
recipes.directions: Bake potatoes at 425 for 40 minutes.    Cut in half and scoop out potato leaving 3/8 in. shell.    Cut each potato in half lengthwise.    Brush inside and outside of potato with butter.    Place cut side up and bake at 425 for 15 minutes.    Stir remaining ingredients together.    Place 1 tbs. of mixture on each potato and bake 5 minutes more.

recipes.title: Ricotta Puffs
recipes.directions: Mix first 5 ingredients in a large bowl.    Form into small balls.    Roll in breadcrumbs mixed with 3 tbs. of Parmesan cheese.    Heat oil.  When hot, drop in the ricotta balls.    Cook for 3 minutes and drain on paper towel.    Place on platter and serve with sauce.

recipes.title: Shrimp Bundles
recipes.directions: Place scallion tops in boiling minute for 1 minute.    Remove and cool.  Cut in thin strips 80x22 long.    Lay 1 shrimp over mushroom cap - stem side down.    Wrap scallion around mushroom/shrimp.    Mix mustard, wine and worcestershire sauce together.    Brush bottom  and top with mixture.    Cover and refrigerate 2 hours.    Broil 40x22 from heat for 4 -5 minutes.

recipes.title: Smoked Salmon Pinwheels
recipes.directions: Spread cream cheese over tortilla. (Save a small amount for the end.)    Place spinach leaves and pepper strips on cream cheese.    Roll up tortilla tightly,  spread with additional cream cheese to seal roll.      Wrap securely with plastic wrap and refrigerate at least 2 hours.    To serve, cut into 1 inch pieces.

recipes.title: Spinach Dip
recipes.directions: Mix all ingredients.    Refrigerate at least 2 hours.

recipes.title: Stuffed Mushrooms
recipes.directions: Chop stems.  Saute with onion and butter. (5min.)      Add bread crumbs and cook 2 min.    Stir in lemon juice, salt and Wor. sauce.    Fill caps.    Bake at 400 for 15 minutes.    Top with cheese and bake 5 minutes more.l

recipes.title: Stuffed Pepperoncini
recipes.directions: Cook bacon.  Remove and drain.    Cook onion and red pepper in oil, about 5 minutes.    In small bowl, with mixer at medium speed, beat cream cheese and milk until smooth.  Crumble bacon.  By hand, mix in bacon, onion and red pepper and mix just until combined.      Cut a slit lengthwise in each pepper being careful not to cut all the way through the pepper.  Fill each pepper with cream cheese mixture.  Cover and refrigerate up to 1 day.  Makes about 28 stuffed peppers.

recipes.title: Taco Dip
recipes.directions: Blend sour cream and cream cheese.    Spread in casserole dish.    Spread taco sauce over cream cheese mixture.    Add a layer of shredded cheese, green pepper, onions and tomatoes.    Top with cheddar cheese, black olives, and salsa.    Serve with tortilla chips.

recipes.title: Tex-Mex Dip
recipes.directions: Spread bean dip on platter.    Mash avocado. (Add water, if necessary.)  Add lemon juice, salt and pepper.    Spread over bean dip.    Mix sour cream, mayonnaise and taco seasoning and spread over avocado.    Top with onion, tomato, olives and cheese.

recipes.title: Tortellini Appetizer
recipes.directions: Cook and drain tortellini.    Thread 3 on each skewer and arrange on platter.    Serve with tomato sauce and ranch cheese sauce.        Ranch Cheese Sauce :  Mix 1/2 cup of ranch salad dressing with 1/2 cup parmesan cheese.         Serve at room temperature.

recipes.title: Waldorf Dip
recipes.directions: Combine first 5 ingredients and beat until smooth.    Stir in celery and raisins.  Add more milk, 1 tbs. at a time, until mixture is dipping consistency.    Cover and chill.      At serving time sprinkle with nuts.    Serve with apple and pear wedges.

recipes.title: Warm Pastrami Dip
recipes.directions: Combine all ingredients.    Spread in 90x22 pie plate.    Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes    Serve with bagel chips.    Makes 4 cups of dip.

recipes.title: Coconut Egg Nog
recipes.directions: Beat yolks and cream of coconut until thick.  (10 minutes)  Cover and refrigerate.        Mix yolk mixture and milk in punch bowl.    Beat egg whites until stiff and fold into egg yolks.    Beat cream until stiff and fold into egg yolks.    Stir in coconut flakes.

recipes.title: Eggnog
recipes.directions: Beat egg yolks and light cream.    Add sugar and salt.    Stir in vanilla and rum.    Chill 3 - 4 hours.    Whip egg whites until stiff.    Whip heavy cream until stiff.    Fold all 3 together and sprinkle with cinnamon.

recipes.title: Holiday Eggnog
recipes.directions: Combine eggs with sugar, milk and vanilla.    Beat with wire whip until fluffy.    Beat cream until stiff.    Fold into egg mixture.    Mix in brandy to taste.    Pour into punch cups and sprinkle with nutmeg.        Makes 1 quart.

recipes.title: Pina Colada Punch
recipes.directions: Mix all ingredients in punch bowl.    Sprinkle with coconut and/or frozen strawberries.

recipes.title: Amish Friendship Bread
recipes.directions: Starter :  Mix 1/2 cup EACH of flour, skim milk, sugar, and 1 tbs. of yellow corn meal in plastic bowl and cover loosely with aluminum foil.  Stir each day with wooden spoon.  (It will take more than a week - It will have a yeast smell when ready.)  Begin at day 5.        Day 1 :  Do nothing.    Day 2, 3, 4 :  Stir with a wooden spoon.    Day 5 :  Add 1 c. flour, 1 c. sugar, and 1 c. milk.  Place in bowl with lid.    Day 6, 7, 8, 9 :  Stir with wooden spoon.    Day 10 :  Add 1 c.flour, 1 c. sugar, and 1 c. milk.    Mix and pour 1 cup of mixture into 3 separate containers.(There will be 1/2 cup remaining.)        Add all ingredients to 1/2 cup of starter and mix by hand.  Pour into 2 greased and sugared loaf pans or 1 tube/bundt pan.    Bake at 350 for 45 minutes. (Cover with foil after 25 minutes.)      Cool 10 minutes and remove from pan.

recipes.title: Blueberry Cornmeal Muffins
recipes.directions: Mix dry ingredients.    Cut in butter with pastry blender.    Stir in yogurt and egg.    Add berries.    Bake at 350 for 20 - 25 minutes.

recipes.title: Blueberry Muffins
recipes.directions: Mix butter and sugar.    Add eggs.    Add vanilla, baking powder and salt.    Fold in half of the milk and half of the flour. Repeat.    Add berries.    Bake at 375 for 25 - 30 minutes.

recipes.title: Bread Pudding
recipes.directions: Preheat oven to 350. Spray 2 cup casserole with nonstick spray.    Arrange bread cubes and apple in 2 cup casserole.    In small bowl combine milk, egg, sugar and vanilla and beat until smooth.    Pour milk mixture over bread and apple. Sprinkle with cinnamon and nutmeg.    Bake for 35 - 40 minutes (until pudding is lightly browned and knife inserted in center comes out clean.)    Remove from oven and let stand 15 minutes before serving.        Makes 1 serving.    Each serving provides :  1 protein, 1 bread, 1 fruit, 1 milk,                                        20 optional calories     Variation :  Substitute 2 tbs. raisins for the apple.

recipes.title: Broccoli Cornbread
recipes.directions: Combine broccoli, cottage cheese, onion, egg, margarine, and salt until blended,  stir in cornmeal.    Spray 9' glass pie plate with Pam.  Spread mixture into pie plate.    Bake at 350 for 30 minutes.  Let stand 10 minutes before serving.        Per serving :  142 calories        Each serving provides :  1 fat, 1/2 protein, 1/2 vegetable, 1 bread, 5 optional calories        3 points

recipes.title: Carrot-Cake Muffins
recipes.directions: Mix sugar, flour, cinnamon, baking soda and salt.    Add fruit and nuts.    In separate bowl, beat eggs, oil and vanilla.    Pour egg mixture into dry ingredients and blend.    Spoon batter into muffin papers.    Bake at 350 for 25 minutes.

recipes.title: Cornbread with corn
recipes.directions: Combine first 5 ingredients in large bowl.  Mix well.    Combine corn, butter, milk and eggs.  Pour into flour mixture and stir to blend.      Pour into 8 inch greased square pan.  (or 12 muffin cups)    Bake at 400 degrees for 25 - 30 minutes.  (bake 15-20 min. for muffins.)

recipes.title: Cranberry Butter
recipes.directions: Chop cranberries and sugar in food processor.    Combine butter and chopped cranberries and mix by hand until blended but still chunky.    Cover and refrigerate.        (You can prepare this a week in advance.)

recipes.title: Gingerbread Squares
recipes.directions: Stir together the flours, baking powder, ginger, cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves, mustard, salt, cayenne and black pepper.      In a separate bowl, cream together butter and sugar until fluffy.  Beat in molasses and eggs.  Stir in 1/4 tsp. of baking soda until bubbles form.    Combine boiling water and remaining baking soda.  Stir into the butter mixture, blending well.  Add dry ingredients.  Mix well.    Pour batter into a greased 90x22 square pan.    Bake at 350 degrees for 45 - 60 minutes, until a skewer inserted into the center comes out clean.

recipes.title: Lauren's monkey bread
recipes.directions: Melt the butter and mix with water and brown sugar.      Cut the biscuits into quarters.      Dip the pieces into the mixture and put on a plate around a circular jar.      Microwave for 2-2 1/2 minutes.

recipes.title: Peanut Biscuits
recipes.directions: Separate biscuits into 20 pieces.    Cut cream cheese into 20 pieces.    Slit biscuit and insert cream cheese.  Pinch closed.    Combine sugar, nuts and orange rind.    Dip biscuit in butter and sugar mixture.    Place side-by-side in round pan.    Sprinkle remaining mixture on top of biscuits.    Bake at 350 for 30 - 35 minutes.    Cool 2 minutes and serve.

recipes.title: Pesto Pizza
recipes.directions: Blend spinach, basil, oil and garlic in food processor.    Spread pesto on pizza crust.    Top with vegetables and cheese.    Bake at 450 degrees until cheese melts.  (10 minutes)

recipes.title: Pumpkin Spice Bread
recipes.directions: Combine flour, sugar, baking soda, cinnamon, salt, cloves, nutmeg and baking powder,  Stir in raisins.    In another bowl, beat together pumpkin, eggs, oil and water with a fork.      Add pumpkin mixture to flour mixture and stir just until moistened.    Pour batter into a greased loaf pan.    Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour or until toothpick comes out clean.    Cook in pan for 10 minutes.  Remove from pan and cool completely.

recipes.title: Sticky Buns
recipes.directions: Cut rolls into 8 slices.    Put brown sugar, corn syrup and butter in 80x22 pan and heat in oven until sugar dissolves.    Stir in vanilla and nuts.    Arrange slices in pan.    Bake at 375 for 15 minutes.

recipes.title: Sweet Potato Muffins
recipes.directions: Cream butter, sugar and sweet potatoes.    Add eggs and blend.    Mix flour, baking powder and spices together and add alternately with milk.    DO NOT OVERMIX.    Fold in raisins and nuts.    Bake at 400 for 25 minutes.

recipes.title: Apple Lasagna
recipes.directions: Mix cheddar cheese, ricotta, egg, sugar, and almond extract.        Spread 1 can of apple pie filling in bottom of greased 9 x 130x22 pan.    Layer 1/2 noodles over filling, spread cheese mixture over noodles.    Top with remaining noodles and remaining can of pie filling.        Combine flour, 6 tbs. brown sugar, oats, cinnamon, and nutmeg.      Cut in butter until crumbly.    Sprinkle over pie filling.        Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes.  Cool 15 minutes.        Blend sour cream and 1/3 cup brown sugar until smooth. Refrigerate.        To serve, cut lasagna into squares and top with sour cream mixture.

recipes.title: Apple Salad
recipes.directions: Chop apples w/skin.  Add walnuts, raisins and cherries.    In separate bowl beat heavy cream w/ sugar and vanilla.    Stir in cherry juice to make the cream pink.    Fold cream into apples.    Refrigerate until ready to serve.    Garnish with additional cherries

recipes.title: Blintz Souffle
recipes.directions: Mix first 8 ingredients together for the batter.    Mix next 5 ingredients together for the filling.    Pour half the batter into buttered 9x130x22 pan.    Top with filling.    Pour remaining batter over filling.    Bake at 350 for 45 minutes.    Unbaked souffle may be covered and refrigerated for several hours or overnight.  Before baking, bring to room temperature.    Serve with sour cream and jams.

recipes.title: Breakfast Crepes
recipes.directions: Add milk to eggs.  Whisk in flour, butter, vanilla and salt.  Mix until smooth.  Pour 1/4 cup of batter into pan and brown lightly.    Fill crepes with ricotta filling or banana filling.    Dust with powdered sugar.

recipes.title: Candied Sweet Potatoes
recipes.directions: Boil, drain, peel and slice sweet potatoes.    Place in single layer of pan.    Boil remaining ingredients and pour over potatoes.    Sprinkle with nuts.    Bake at 350 for 20 minutes.

recipes.title: Caramel Biscuit Ring
recipes.directions: Heat all ingredients except biscuits until butter melts.    Quarter biscuits.      Mix biscuits into heated mixture and spoon into pan.    Sprinkle with raisins.    Bake at 400 for 20 - 30 minutes.    Let stand 3 minutes.    Invert onto plate.

recipes.title: Caramel Nut Ring
recipes.directions: Combine sugar, butter, water, cinnamon, vanilla and corn syrup.    Heat until butter melts.    Mix thoroughly and add nuts and raisins.    Separate biscuits and cut into quarters.    Mix biscuit pieces into sugar mixture.    Spoon into greased bundt pan.    Bake at 400 for 20 - 30 minutes or until golden brown.    Let stand 3 minutes.    Invert onto serving plate.

recipes.title: Cherry-Pineapple Cake/Cobbler
recipes.directions: Mix cherries and pineapple.    Sprinkle with cake mix.    Drizzle with butter.    Bake at 350 for 1 hour.

recipes.title: Chocolate Tortoni
recipes.directions: Melt unsweetened and semisweet chocolates in separate pans.    Beat egg whites with cream of tartar until foamy.  Gradually add sugar until soft peaks form.    Beat 2 cups of cream until stiff.  Add 2 tsp. sugar, vanilla, and unsweetened chocolate.  Blend well.    Fold egg whites, almonds and semisweet chocolate into whipped cream mixture.    Spoon mixture into paper cupcake liners.      Freeze 4 hours or overnight.

recipes.title: Creamy eggs
recipes.directions: Cook mushrooms in butter.    Add bacon, lemon juice and a dash of pepper.    Combine flour and milk and stir into mushrooms.    Bring to boiling and cook until thickened.    Spread a thin layer of sauce over bottom of 9x130x22 pan.    Slice eggs and arrange over sauce.    Sprinkle with cheese.    (Can be assembled up to this point 1 day ahead and refrigerated.)    Bake at 375 for 15 - 20 minutes.

recipes.title: Crumb Cake
recipes.directions: Prepare cake mix  following directions on box.    Spread on large cookie sheet sprayed with Pam.    Bake at 350 for 15 minutes.    Mix remaining ingredients until crumbly.    Sprinkle on cake.    Bake at 350 for 15 minutes more.

recipes.title: Death by Chocolate
recipes.directions: Prepare pudding in two separate bowls.    Mix one bowl of pudding with one tub of Cool Whip.    In large bowl layer :  1/2 cake, 1/2 chocolate pudding, 1/2 Cool Whip, 1/2 pudding/Cool Whip mixture, 1/2 Heath bars.        Repeat with second layer.        Refrigerate for 8 hours or overnight.

recipes.title: Eclair Pie
recipes.directions: Mix milk with pudding.  Fold in Cool Whip.    In 9x130x22 pan put a layer of graham crackers and top with half of pudding.    Cover with another layer of graham crackers and remaining pudding.    Top with graham crackers.    Cover graham crackers with chocolate icing.        Icing :   Combine all ingredients.    3 tbs. cocoa    3 tbs. milk    3 tbs. melted butter    1 1/2 cups 10x sugar        Better if refrigerated overnight.

recipes.title: Ham and Egg Casserole
recipes.directions: Butter 1 1/2 quart baking dish.    Layer potatoes, eggs and ham.    Season with salt and pepper.    Bake at 350 for 10 minutes.    Beat egg.    Blend in sour cream.    Pour over potatoes, egg and ham.    Return to oven and bake 5 minutes more.

recipes.title: Holiday Sweet Potatoes
recipes.directions: Cover and simmer sweet potatoes for 30 - 40 minutes.    Drain, peel and slice 1/20x22 thick.    Heat 1/2 cup pineapple juice, orange and lemon slices, sugar, raisins, butter, cinnamon, nutmeg and allspice to boiling.    Reduce heat to low, cover and simmer until mixture thickens (10 min)    Discard orange and lemon slices.    Arrange potatoes in 9x130x22 pan.  Tuck pineapple, oranges, bananas and pecans among potatoes.    Pour sauce over potatoes.  Top with marshmallows.    Bake at 350 for 20 - 25 minutes.

recipes.title: Karen's Macaroni Salad
recipes.directions: Cook macaroni and mix with Miracle Whip.    Cool in refrigerator.        Heat egg, vinegar and sugar until thick.    Cool in refrigerator.        Chop vegetables.        When macaroni and egg mixture are cool, mix together.     Add celery seed, salt and pepper to taste.        Just before serving add vegetables and more Miracle Whip.

recipes.title: Mexican Salad
recipes.directions: Fry beef and drain.    Dice tomatoes and peppers.    Mix beef, vegetables, Catalina, and taco sauce.    Add crumbled Doritos and cheese when ready to serve.        Add more Catalina if salad is dry.

recipes.title: Pineapple Pudding 1
recipes.directions: Mix all ingredients and put in buttered casserole.    Bake at 350 for 1 hour.

recipes.title: Pineapple Pudding 2
recipes.directions: Mix together bread and pineapple.    Beat eggs until light and fluffy.    Beat in butter and sugar.    Pour over bread.    Pour into buttered baking dish.    Bake at 350 for 40 minutes.

recipes.title: Quiche
recipes.directions: Sprinkle cheese on bottom of pie crust.    Combine the remaining ingredients and pour into shell.    Bake at 425 for 15 minutes.    Reduce heat to 350 and bake 45 minutes more.

recipes.title: Scalloped Sweet Potatoes
recipes.directions: Cover potatoes with water.  Boil and reduce to simmer - 15 minutes or until tender but firm.  Drain.    Slice potatoes 1/20x22 thick.    Place in double layer and dot with butter.    Using wire whisk, beat cream,1/4 cup brown sugar and  1/2 tsp. cinnamon.  Pour over potatoes.    Cover with foil.    Bake at 325 for 15 minutes.    Sprinkle with remaining brown sugar, cinnamon and walnuts.    Bake, uncovered, 8 - 10 minutes more.

recipes.title: Sweet Potato Casserole with Praline Topping
recipes.directions: Beat eggs and stir in potatoes.    Add remaining ingredients for potatoes and mix.    Spread in greased dish.        Mix brown sugar, flour and pecans.    Add butter and blend.    Sprinkle over potatoes.    Bake at 350 for 60 - 70 minutes.

recipes.title: Sweet Potatoes and Apple Casserole
recipes.directions: Butter baking dish.    Layer half of sweet potatoes, half of butter, half of apples and repeat.    Cover with aluminum foil.    Bake at 350 for 40 minutes.

recipes.title: Tortellini in Tomato-Cream Sauce
recipes.directions: Cook celery, carrots and onion in oil for 5 minutes.    Add tomatoes with liquid, salt, pepper and sugar.    Heat to boiling.    Reduce to medium and cook, uncovered, for 10 minutes.    Prepare tortellini.    Over medium heat add heavy cream and basil to tomato mixture.    Heat through.    Add tortellini.

recipes.title: Walnut-Almond Granola
recipes.directions: Mix honey, oil, vanilla, almond extract and cinnamon in saucepan.  Stir over medium heat just until warm.  Mix bran flakes, oats, almonds, walnuts and coconut in large bowl.  Pour honey mixture over cereal and toss to coat.  Divide granola between 2 baking sheets, spreading evenly.  Bake at 300 degrees until golden brown, stirring every 5 minutes, for about 25 minutes.  Sprinkle raisins over granola and cool completely.

recipes.title: Watergate Salad
recipes.directions: Mix pineapple juice with pudding.    Stir in Cool Whip.    Add pineapple, marshmallows and nuts.    Mix well and refrigerate.

recipes.title: Almond Pound Cake
recipes.directions: Grease and flour a 10 inch Bundt pan.      Combine flour, baking powder and salt.    In large mixing bowl beat butter and cream cheese with an electric mixer on medium to high about 30 seconds.    Gradually add sugar beating on medium speed about 5 minutes until very light and fluffy.      Add almond extract.    Add eggs, 1 at a time beating on low after each one.    Gradually add flour mixture, beating on low speed just until combined.    Spoon into Bundt pan.    Bake at 325 degrees for 75 minutes.    Cool for 15 minutes.    Remove from pan and cool completely for 2 hours.    Top with glaze.        Almond Glaze :    In small mixing bowl beat together all glaze ingredients and spoon over cake.

recipes.title: Blueberry Pudding Cake
recipes.directions: Put berries in 8x80x22 pan.    Mix flour, baking powder, salt, butter, 3/4 cup sugar and milk. Spread over berries.    Mix 1 cup sugar and cornstarch.    Sprinkle over batter.    Pour 1 cup boiling water over mixture.    Bake at 350 for 45 minutes.

recipes.title: Cheesecake Dreams
recipes.directions: Grease 80x22 pan.    Mix br. sugar, flour and walnuts.  Stir in butter.  Pat mixture into pan.    Bake at 350 for 12 - 15 minutes.    In small bowl with electric mixer at medium speed beat cream cheese, and sugar.  Beat in remaining ingredients.  Pour over crust.    Bake at 350 for 25 minutes.

recipes.title: Cranberry Pie
recipes.directions: Mix cranberries, nuts and sugar and put in greased 100x22 pie plate.    Mix remaining ingredients and spoon over berries.    Bake at 350 degrees for 45-50 minutes.

recipes.title: Cream Cheese Cupcakes
recipes.directions: Beat cream cheese, eggs, 1 cup sugar and vanilla and fill cupcake papers.    Bake at 300 for 30 - 40 minutes.    Do not brown.        Mix together sour cream, 1/4 cup sugar and vanilla.    Put 1 tbs. of mixture on each cupcake.    Bake at 300 for 5 minutes more.

recipes.title: Double Chocolate Brownies
recipes.directions: Melt butter and chocolate squares.  Remove from heat.  Beat in sugar with wooden spoon.  Add eggs one at a time.  Stir in vanilla.  Stir in flour.  Add one cup of walnuts.  Spread in greased 9x130x22 pan. Combine 1/2 cup walnuts and chocolate chips.  Sprinkle over top of mixture pressing down lightly.    Bake at 350 for 35 min.        4 sq. unsw. choc.%3D3/4 cup cocoa + 4 tbs. butter

recipes.title: Hot Fudge Pudding Cake
recipes.directions: In ungreased 9x90x22 pan mix flour, sugar, 2 tbs. cocoa, baking powder and salt.    Mix in milk, oil and vanilla.    Stir in nuts.    Spread smoothly and sprinkle with brown sugar and 4 tbs cocoa.    Pour water on top.    Bake at 350 for 40 minutes.

recipes.title: Lemon Squares
recipes.directions: Blend flour, butter and 10x sugar.     Press into 8x80x22 pan.    Bake at 350 for 20 minutes until slightly browned.    Beat remaining ingredients.    Pour over crust.    Bake 20 - 25 minutes more.

recipes.title: Magic Cookie Bars
recipes.directions: In 13x90x22 pan, melt butter.  Remove from heat.    Sprinkle crumbs over butter.    Pour sweetened condensed milk evenly over crumbs.    Top with chocolate chips, coconut and nuts. Press down gently.    Bake at 350 for 25 minutes or until golden brown.     Cool and cut into bars.

recipes.title: Pineapple Angel Food Cake
recipes.directions: Mix together only the two ingredients.    Pour into a 9x130x22 ungreased pan.    Bake at 350 degrees for 30-35 minutes.    (Top came out dark.- Try lowering temperature.)        12 Servings    3 pts.

recipes.title: Southern Comfort Apple Cake
recipes.directions: In a small bowl, stir together apples and Southern Comfort.  Cover and chill for at least 6 hours and no more than 24.  Stir together cinnamon, nutmeg, baking soda, and flour and reserve.    Cream together sugar and oil.  Add eggs, one at a time.  With mixer on lowest speed, add the dry ingredients and mix just until combined.  Using a spatula, gently fold in the apples, Southern Comfort, walnuts, and toffee.      Pour mixture into an 8x80x22 greased pan.      Bake at 350 degrees for 45 - 50 minutes.

recipes.title: Caramel Popcorn
recipes.directions: Melt butter.  Add brown sugar, corn syrup and salt.    Bring to a boil stirring constantly.    Continue to boil for 5 minutes without stirring.    Remove from heat and stir in baking soda and vanilla.    Pour over popcorn and mix well.    Place in glass dish.    Bake at 200 for 1 hour.

recipes.title: Haystacks
recipes.directions: Melt chips and peanut butter.    Stir in noodles and marshmallows.    Drop by spoon onto wax paper.    Refrigerate until hardened - 10 min.

recipes.title: Microwave Cashew Brittle
recipes.directions: In 1 1/2 qt. bowl, mix sugar and corn syrup.    Microwave on high for 4 minutes.    Stir in nuts.    Microwave on high for 4 minutes.    Add butter and vanilla and stir.    Microwave on high 1 minute.    Add baking soda and stir gently until light and foamy.    Pour onto lightly greased cookie sheets.    Cool 1 hour and break into pieces.    Makes 1 lb.

recipes.title: Saltine Crunch Bars
recipes.directions: Line a 15/10 inch cookie sheet with aluminum foil.    Place saltines in a single layer on foil.    Heat butter and brown sugar over medium-high heat.Bring to boil and boil 3 minutes without stirring.    Pour over saltines.    Bake for 7 minutes at 400 degrees.    Immediately sprinkle with chocolate chips.    Let stand 5 minutes.    Spread chocolate over saltines and sprinkle with walnuts.    Cool and cut into pieces.

recipes.title: Toffee
recipes.directions: Line cookie sheet with foil.  Arrange almonds in single layer 12 x170x22.    Heat butter, sugar, vanilla and salt over high heat.  Stir with wooden spoon until butter is melted.  Cook and stir 5 - 7 minutes or until the color of unblanched almonds.  Immediately pour - w/o scraping pan - over the almonds.  Let cool completely.      Melt chocolate in microwave.      Break toffee in pieces and dip in chocolate - spread in thin, even layer - scrape off excess.    Coat with ground walnuts.    Place on foil to set.    Store in tightly covered container in refrigerator.

recipes.title: Amaretto Chunk Cookies
recipes.directions: Combine flour, baking soda, baking powder and salt.    At medium speed, beat butter and sugars until creamy.    Beat in eggs, amaretto and extract.    Reduce speed to low,  beat in flour mixture just until blended.    Stir in chips, coconut and almonds.    Drop dough by heaping tablespoons, 2 inches apart, on ungreased cookie sheet.    Bake cookies for 10 to 12 minutes at 375 degrees.        Makes 4 dozen cookies

recipes.title: Chocolate-Almond Biscotti
recipes.directions: Toast almonds over medium heat.  Cool and chop.    Beat sugar, cocoa, butter, baking powder, almond extract, vanilla, baking soda, salt, eggs, and 1 cup flour with mixer at medium speed until well blended.      With spoon stir in almonds and 1/4 cup of flour.    Divide dough in half.  Shape into 80x22 x 20x22 loaves and place on greased cookie sheet 30x22 apart.    Bake at 350 for 35 - 40 minutes.    Remove from oven and cool for 10 minutes.    Cut into 1/20x22 slices.    Return to oven and bake 5 minutes longer.    Store in airtight container.    Makes 3 dozen cookies.

recipes.title: Chocolate-Covered Cherry Cookies
recipes.directions: Mix flour, cocoa, salt, baking powder and baking soda.      In separate bowl beat butter and sugar.  Add egg and vanilla.    Add butter mixture to dry ingredients.    Shape into 10x22 balls and place on ungreased cookie sheet.    Press down center with thumb.  Place cherry in center.    In saucepan combine chocolate and sw. condensed milk.    Heat until chocolate melts.  Stir in 4 tsp. of cherry juice.    Place 1 tsp. frosting on cookie.  (Frosting may be thinned with cherry juice.    Bake at 350 for 10 minutes.

recipes.title: Chunky Chocolate Jam Bars
recipes.directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees.  Line a 9x130x22 pan with aluminum foil.  Grease foil.        Mix flour, brown sugar and baking powder in a large bowl.    Cut in butter until mixture is crumbly.    Add oats, coconut and pecans and mix well.        Divide mixture in half.  Press half of the crumb mixture onto bottom of baking pan.  Sprinkle with chopped chocolate.  Spoon jam over top.    Sprinkle with remaining crumb mixture.        Bake for 25 - 30 minutes or until lightly browned.  Cool and then lift from pan and cut into squares.

recipes.title: Cocoa Sandies
recipes.directions: Beat butter, sugar, and vanilla in large bowl about 3 minutes or till creamy.    Add cocoa and blend well.    Add flour and salt, beating till smooth.    Roll dough on a lightly floured suface to 1/2 inch thickness.    Cut out cookies.  Place on an ungreased cookie sheet.      Bake for 15 - 20 minutes at 350.

recipes.title: Coconut Macaroons
recipes.directions: Mix all ingredients together.    Drop heaping teaspoons onto greased cookie sheet 2 inches apart.    Gently press mounds together to hold shape.    Press cherry into center of cookie.    Bake at 350 degrees for 10-12 minutes.

recipes.title: Cranberry-Pecan Delights
recipes.directions: Combine flour, sugar, salt and baking soda.    Beat oil, butter and orange juice on medium speed for 2 minutes.    Beat in egg.    At lowest speed, beat in flour mixture, just until blended.    Add cranberries and pecans.    Beat for 1 minute.    Drop by spoonfuls onto baking sheet.    Bake at 400 degrees for 8 to 10 minutes.        Makes 3 dozen cookies.

recipes.title: Double Chocolate Oatmeal Cookies
recipes.directions: Melt 1 cup chocolate.    Beat butter and sugar.    Blend in eggs, vanilla and 1 cup melted chocolate.    Add all dry ingredients except 10x sugar.    Add 1 cup chocolate chips.    Shape in 10x22 balls.    Roll in 10x sugar and coat heavily.    Place on ungreased cookie sheet.    Bake at 350 for 10 - 12 minutes.

recipes.title: Ginger Cookies
recipes.directions: Combine first 6 ingredients.    In separate bowl beat butter on low for 30 seconds.    Gradually add 1 cup sugar and beat until fluffy.    Add egg and molasses and beat well.    Add dry ingredients.    Shape into 1 1/20x22 balls.    Roll in sugar.    Place on ungreased cookie sheet 2 1/20x22 apart.    Bake at 350 for 10 minutes.

recipes.title: Gramercy Chocolate Brownie Cookie
recipes.directions: In a small bowl, whisk flour, baking powder and salt.        In the bowl of an electric mixer, briefly whip the eggs to break them up.  Add the sugar and vanilla and beat on high speed for 15 minutes, until thick.        Place the butter in the top of a double boiler and melt with bittersweet chocolate and unsweetened chocolate.  Heat until melted.  Remove from heat and stir until smooth.        Gently fold the chocolate mixture into the egg mixture until partially combined (there should still be some streaks).  Add the flour mixture to the batter and carefully fold it in.  Fold in the chocolate chips.  If the batter is very runny, let it rest until it thickens slightly, about 5 minutes.        Drop the batter onto greased cookie sheets.  Bake until puffy and cracked, 8 to 9 minutes at 375 degrees.        Variations :    Substitute 1/2 cup chopped nuts for an equal amount of chocolate chips.

recipes.title: Italian Cookies
recipes.directions: Cream butter and sugar.  Add vanilla and eggs.    Add ricotta cheese and mix by hand.    Stir in dry ingredients.    Drop by teaspoon onto ungreased cookie sheet.    Bake at 350 for 10 - 12 minutes.    Icing :  1 cup butter              1 1/2 cups 10x sugar              1/4 cup evaporated milk              Pinch of salt    Cream butter and sugar.  Add milk and salt.  Beat on high speed for 5 minutes.  Any flavoring may be added.  (anisette)

recipes.title: Magic Peanut Butter Middles
recipes.directions: Mix together flour, cocoa and baking soda.    In separate bowl cream sugar, brown sugar, butter and peanut butter.  Add vanilla and egg.    Stir in flour mixture.    For the filling, mix together 3/4 cup peanut butter and 3/4 cup 10x sugar.  Shape into 30 balls.    Shape 1 tbs.chocolate dough around peanut butter ball.    Place on ungreased cookie sheet.    Flatten with glass dipped in sugar.    Bake at 375 for 7 minutes.

recipes.title: Oatmeal Cranberry White Chocolate Chunk Cookies
recipes.directions: Beat butter and sugar until light and fluffy.    Add eggs, mixing well.    Combine oats, flour, baking soda and salt in a separate bowl.    Add to butter mixture in several additions, mixing well after each addition.    Stir in cranberries and white chocolate chips.    Drop by teaspoon onto ungreased baking sheet.    Bake at 375 degrees for 10 to 12 minutes.        Makes 2 1/2 dozens.

recipes.title: Pfeffernusse
recipes.directions: Combine flour, baking powder, pepper, salt, ginger, cinnamon, cloves, and nutmeg.     In another bowl, beat butter, molasses and sugar until fluffy.    Beat in egg until blended.    Refrigerate dough until chilled.  Shape into 10x22 balls and place 20x22 apart on greased baking sheet.    Bake at 350 degrees for 12 - 15 minutes.    While still warm, roll cookies in confectioner's sugar.    Cool and roll in sugar again.

recipes.title: Pizzelles
recipes.directions: Beat eggs, adding sugar gradually.  Beat until smooth.  Add cooled margarine and vanilla or anise.  Sift flour and baking powder.  Blend into egg mixture until smooth.  Dough will be sticky enough to be dropped by spoon.  Bake in Pizzelle Baker.

recipes.title: Potato Chip Cookies
recipes.directions: Combine butter and 1 cup confectioner's sugar in large bowl.    Beat on medium for 3 minutes.    Add egg yolk and vanilla and beat till well mixed.    Gradually beat in flour.    Stir in potato chips and pecans with a wooden spoon.    Drop onto greased cookie sheet.     Bake  at 350 for 10 minutes.    While cookies are still warm, sift with confectioner's sugar.

recipes.title: Pumpkin Cookies
recipes.directions: Cream butter and sugar.    Beat in egg, pumpkin and vanilla.    Mix dry ingredients and add to butter mixture.    Stir in almonds and chocolate chips.    Drop by teaspoon onto greased cookie sheet.    Bake at 350 for 15 minutes.

recipes.title: Snickerdoodles
recipes.directions: Cream butter, sugar and eggs.    Stir in remaining ingredients.    Refrigerate 30 minutes.    Shape in 10x22 balls.    Mix 2 tsp. cinnamon and 2 tbs. sugar.    Roll balls in sugar mixture.    Bake at 375 for 12 - 15 minutes.

recipes.title: TollHouse Cookies
recipes.directions: Cream butter and sugar.    Mix in brown sugar and eggs.    Mix in all other dry ingredients and vanilla.    Stir in chips and nuts.    Bake at 375 for 8 - 10 minutes.

recipes.title: Banana Pudding with Cool Whip
recipes.directions: Combine milk and pudding.    Add sweetened condensed milk and mix.    Blend in Cool Whip.    In large bowl pour a thin layer of pudding mixture.    Top with a layer of vanilla wafers and a layer of bananas.    Repeat until pudding is used.    Chill for 24 hours.

recipes.title: Black Forest Pie
recipes.directions: Combine sugar, cocoa and flour.  Add butter and milk.  Cook until mixture begins to boil.  Remove from heat.  Add small amount of mixture to eggs and return to pan.      Fold HALF of pie filling into mixture.    Pour into pie shell.    Bake at 350 for 35 - 45 minutes.    Cool and chill  for 1 hour.    Spread with 2 cups of Cool Whip.    Top with the remaining pie filling.

recipes.title: Blueberry Delight
recipes.directions: Preheat broiler.    Place blueberries in a glass pie pan.    Combine sour cream and yogurt.    Spoon mixture over berries.    Sprinkle with brown sugar.    Place pie pan under broiler for 2 minutes or until sugar has melted.    Divide into 4 portions.        Calories per serving :  84    Fat :  3g

recipes.title: Candied Nuts
recipes.directions: Beat 2 egg whites with 2 teaspoons of water (WITH A WOODEN SPOON).  Using the wooden spoon mix egg white with nuts and coat all nuts.        In a separate bowl mix :    3/4 - 1 cup sugar    1-2 tsp. pumpkin pie spice    2/3 tsp. salt        Blend well and pour over nuts.    Mix with wooden spoon.    Line cookie sheet with aluminum foil and spray.    Spread nuts on cookie sheet.     Bake for 20 - 25 minutes at 350 degrees.        Immediately place nuts on wax paper and toss with raisins.

recipes.title: Cannoli Pie
recipes.directions: Combine all ingredients and mix slowly.    Spoon into 2 pie shells.    Refrigerate.

recipes.title: Cheesecake Chip Dip
recipes.directions: Mix cream cheese, sugar, vanilla and milk until smooth.     Fold in Cool Whip.    Chill.    Serve with Cinnamon Sugar Pita Chips

recipes.title: Chocolate Fondue
recipes.directions: Heat yolks and cream until thick. (15 minutes)    Add chocolate and stir until melted.  DO NOT BOIL%21    Remove from heat and add amaretto and vanilla.        Serve with pineapple, maraschino cherries, banana, apples, mandarin oranges, pound cake, strawberries.

recipes.title: Fudge Chocolate Torte
recipes.directions: Mix melted butter, cocoa and 3/4 sugar.  Remove from heat and cool for 5 minutes.  Add almonds and flour.  Beat in yolks.  Add water.  Beat egg whites until foamy.  Add 1/4 cup sugar.  Fold chocolate into egg whites.  Pour into greased and floured 90x22 layer cake pan.  Bake at 350 for 30 minutes.  Cool 10 minutes and remove  from pan.  Cool completely and glaze.     Glaze :  Melt 2 butter.  Add 2 tbs. cocoa and 2 tbs. water.  Do not boil.  Remove from heat.  Add 1/2 tsp. vanilla.  Add 1 cup 10x sugar.

recipes.title: Fudge Muffins
recipes.directions: Melt butter with chocolate.    Combine sugar, flour and salt.    Stir in chocolate mixture.    Add eggs and vanilla and whisk just until moist - do not overmix.    Fold in nuts.    Spoon into paper muffin cups 2/3 full.    Bake at 300 for 40 minutes.

recipes.title: Peach Cobbler
recipes.directions: Sprinkle peaches with lemon juice.    Spread in 80x22 pan.    Mix flour, sugar and salt.    Add egg and toss until crumbly.    Sprinkle over peaches.    Drizzle with butter and sprinkle with cinnamon.    Bake at 375 for 45 minutes.

recipes.title: Sugarless Cheesecake
recipes.directions: Beat cream cheese and sweetener until very smooth, about 3 min.    Add the eggs, one at a time.    Add vanilla and salt.    Beat in the sour cream until just blended.    Grease an 80x22 springboard pan and line bottom with waxed paper.    Wrap outside of pan with a double layer of aluminum foil.    Pour batter into pan.    Set pan in a large roasting pan and surround with 10x22 of hot water.    Bake for 45 min. at 350 degrees.    Turn off the oven without opening door and leave for 1 hour.    Remove to rack and cool to room temperature.

recipes.title: Blueberry Lemonade
recipes.directions: Make a syrup with 1 cup sugar and water.  Boil over medium heat and continue simmering for 1 minute.  Remove from heat and let cool.        Puree blueberries and 2 tbs. of sugar in food processor.        In a pitcher, combine syrup, lemon juice and blueberry puree.        To serve, pour 1/4 to 1/3 of base into glass and fill with water.        Makes base for 12 servings.

recipes.title: Creamy Limoncello
recipes.directions: Zest the lemons and place in a container with the alcohol.    Let sit for 2 weeks.    In a large pot, heat sugar and cream until sugar dissolves, about 5 minutes.    Let mixture cool completely.    Strain the lemon/alcohol mixture and add to the pot.    Pour mixture into bottles.

recipes.title: Limoncello
recipes.directions: Peel lemons.    Use zest only.    Soak peels in alcohol for 14 days.    After 14 days, heat 2 liters of water and dissolve 2 cups of sugar and stir until water is clear.    Let cool.    Strain alcohol and discard peels.    Mix alcohol with cooled sugar water.    Keep in freezer.    Drink in frosted glasses.    Enjoy.

recipes.title: Marge's Limoncello
recipes.directions: Wash lemons in hot water.    Remove the peel with a vegetable peeler, removing all white pith on the back of the peel by scraping with a knife and put the peels in a 4 quart Mason jar.    Add 1 bottle of vodka and stir.    Cover jar, date it, and put it in a dark cabinet at room temperature.    After 40 days, take out the vodka-lemon mixture.    In a saucepan set over high heat, stir the sugar and water together and boil for 5 minutes.    Let the sugar syrup cool completely in the pan, about 10 minutes.    Add the sugar syrup to the vodka-lemon mixtrue along with the second bottle of vodka.    Stir weel to combine.    Replace the cover on the jar and note the finish date.    Return it to the dark cabinet and store for 40 more days.    At Day 80, remove the limoncello from the cabinet.    Strain the mixture and discard the lemon peel.    Pour into clean, unused bottles with caps or decorative corked bottles.    Store the bottles in the pantry, but put one bottle at a time in the freezer until ready for use.    Makes approximately 3 quarts.

recipes.title: Sangria
recipes.directions: Boil water, sugar, cinnamon stick, one slice of lemon and one slice of lime.  Bring to a boil and reduce heat to a simmer until mixture becomes thick.  (Do not boil more than 7 minutes.)  Add a splash of cognac or brandy and cool mixture.         Slice one orange and cut the other in wedges.  Add slices of citrus fruits to bottom of pitcher.  Use all the slices of oranges but only 2 slices of lemon and 2 of lime.  Add apple and orange wedges.          Pour cooled syrup over fruit.  Save cinnamon stick.  Add orange juice, cognac and brandy.  Stir, cover with saran wrap and refrigerate for 30 minutes.        Add wine to the pitcher.  Add banana.  Stick cinnamon stick in an apple slice and add to pitcher.  Cover with saran wrap and refrigerate for 1 hour.  Remove cinnamon stick.          Chill for 5 more hours.        Add coconut rum and serve.

recipes.title: Apple-Pear Tortilla Roll-Ups
recipes.directions: Combine apple, pear, cheese, applesauce, raisins, lemon juice, and cinnamon.    Spread the bottom section of each tortilla with one quarter of the apple-pear mixture.  Fold the bottom flap over the filling, the two side flaps inward, and then roll up each tortilla.    Calories per serving :  113    Fat :  2g

recipes.title: Applesauce
recipes.directions: Cook apples, water and lemon juice until soft.    Beat with mixer.    Add sugar and cinnamon.

recipes.title: Rotelle-Fruit Salad
recipes.directions: Toss cooked rotelle with all the fruit.    Combine yogurt and juice concentrate.    Toss yogurt dressing with rotelle and fruit.    Chill for 2 hours before serving.    Calories per serving :  183    Fat :  9g

recipes.title: Chicken, Shrimp and Fruit Salad
recipes.directions: For the salad, in a large bowl combine chicken, grapes, cantaloupe, water chestnuts, and shrimp.  Cover and chill for several hours.        For dressing, in a small bowl mash the banana.  Stir in the mayo and lemon juice.  Cover,  chill several hours.        Arrange lettuce leaves on plates.  Serve salad atop lettuce.  Drizzle with dressing.

recipes.title: Amaretto Marinade
recipes.directions: Combine all ingredients.

recipes.title: Honey-Grilled Vegetables
recipes.directions: Cover potatoes with water and simmer 5 minutes,  drain.    Combine honey, wine, garlic, salt, and pepper.    Place vegetables on grill and cook for 20 - 25 minutes, turning and brushing with honey mixture every 7 -8 minutes.        Or :        Marinate vegetables in honey mixture.

recipes.title: Jack Daniels Sauce
recipes.directions: Cut off 1/20x22 top of garlic.  Cut bottom flat.  Remove papery skin.  Drizzle with oil, cover with foil and bake at 325 degrees for 1 hour.    Let cool.        Combine water, pineapple juice, teriyaki sauce, soy sauce and brown sugar over medium heat.  Stir until mixture boils.  Reduce and simmer    Squeeze garlic and add 2 tsp. to pan.  Add remaining ingredients and stir.  Let simmer 40-50 minutes or until reduced by half.      (Mixture should be thick and syrupy.)

recipes.title: London Broil Marinade
recipes.directions: Mix all ingredients except the london broil.    Slice london broil thinly.    Add to marinade and marinate overnight.    Soak skewers overnight.    Thread meat on skewers and grill.

recipes.title: Mediterranean Sauce for Fish
recipes.directions: Saute onions and garlic in oil.    Add tomatoes, capers, olives and artichokes and stir.    Add stock and season with salt, pepper and cayenne.    Cook, stirring occasionally, for 15 minutes.

recipes.title: California Veal Cutlets
recipes.directions: Pound each veal cutlet to 1/80x22 thickness.    Heat butter over medium-high heat and cook veal cutlets until browned on both sides, about 3 - 4 minutes.    Arrange veal in pan in single layer and sprinkle with salt.    Top veal with tomato slice, avocado slice, and shredded cheese.    Reduce heat to low,  cover pan and heat until cheese melts.    Serve with lemony vinaigrette.      Lemony Vinaigrette :Heat 3 tbs. lemon juice                                          3 tbs. olive oil                                          1 tbs. water                                          1 1/2 tsp. sugar                                          1/8 tsp. salt

recipes.title: Chicken with Dried Beef
recipes.directions: Mix sour cream and soup.    Break up dried beef and spread in pan.    Wrap bacon around chicken.  Place on top of dried beef.    Pour soup over chicken.        Bake at 300 for 2 - 3 hours.

recipes.title: Flank Steak Deluxe
recipes.directions: Cut flank steak into 4 portions.  Sprinkle both sides of each piece with flour, using a total of 1 tbs.,  rub to coat.  Set aside.    Melt 3 tbs. butter over medium heat.  Add onion and cook 5-7 minutes.  Transfer onion to a large bowl and reserve.    Adding a little more butter if needed, quickly brown meat over medium-high heat.  Tranfer meat to bowl with onion.  Whisk remaining 2 tbs. flour into butter.  Gradually whisk in 2 cups water, vinegar, dry mustard, paprika, thyme, cayenne, salt, and pepper.  Increase heat to high and cook, whisking until mixture bubbles, 2-4 minutes.    Return meat and onions to sauce, cover, reduce heat and simmer until meat is tender, 30-45 minutes.      Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Flank Steak Stuffed with Corn and Herbs
recipes.directions: Heat 2 tbs. olive oil.  Add red pepper, scallions, garlic, and 1/2 cup onion.  Stir over medium heat 2-3 minutes.  Scrape mixture into large bowl.  Add bread crumbs, corn, basil, salt, pepper, and egg to onion mixture.  Mix together,  set aside.    Place flank steak on a wooden board and pound with mallet until it is 1/3 to 1/2 inch thick.  Spread stuffing evenly down middle, leaving 10x22 border along long sides.    Cut five 70x22 lengths of twine.  Fold long sides  together, overlapping them to over stuffing.  Tie with string.  Rub with flour and season with salt and pepper.    Heat remaining 2 tbs. olive oil.  Add meat and brown on all sides over medium-high heat, about 7 minutes.  Carefully remove to platter.  Add remaining 1 cup onions and stir over medium heat until softened, 2-4 minutes.  Stir in tomatoes, wine, and broth,  bring to boil.  Add meat, seam side up.    Cover and bake for 1 hour at 350 degrees.  Baste, cover again and reduce temperature to 325 degrees.  Braise until meat is tender, about 1 hour more.    Transfer meat to carving board.  Carefully remove string.  Carve into 1/20x22 slices.  Spoon sauce over meat and serve.

recipes.title: Flank Steak with Horseradish Sauce
recipes.directions: Score the surface of the steak with shallow diagonal cuts at 10x22 intervals, making diamond shapes.  Repeat on other side.    In a large plastic bag, combine the next five ingredients.    Add steak and seal bag.  Refrigerate overnight.    Combine sauce ingredients, cover and refrigerate.    Grill steak.  Thinly slice across the grain.

recipes.title: Ham and Vegetables with Pasta
recipes.directions: Cook pasta.  Drain and set aside.    In a medium saucepan combine zucchini, onion, and 1/4 cup of water.  Bring to boiling,  reduce heat.  Simmer, covered, for 4 -5 minutes or until vegetables are crisp-tender,  drain well.  Return to pan.     For sauce, in a small pan combine cornstarch, basil, marjoram, a little of the evap. milk, and 1/8 tsp. of pepper.  Stir in remaining milk all at once.  Cook and stir until thickened and bubbly.  Stir sauce, ham and pasta into vegetables.  Heat through.          Per serving :  291 calories, 3 g. fat

recipes.title: Ham Rolls
recipes.directions: Stretch pizza dough into 12 x 100x22 rectangle.    In small bowl whisk together yogurt, mustard, and horseradish.    Spread mixture evenly over dough, leaving 1 1/20x22 border.    Arrange ham over dough, sprinkle with cheese and onion.    Starting from wide end, roll dough jelly-roll fashion to enclose filling.    Pinch seam to seal.    Spray baking sheet with Pam.    Arrange roll seam-side down on sheet.    Bake at 425 for 15, until golden brown.    Let cool 10 minutes before cuttin into 10 slices.        Per serving :  137 Calories        Each serving provides :  1 protein, 1 bread, 2 optional calories

recipes.title: Hot Bacon and Chicken Salad
recipes.directions: For dressing :  Stir together Italian dressing and dry mustard.        Add bacon to wok and stir-fry until crisp.    Remove from wok and drain.    Drain fat from wok.        Add oil to wok.  Add mushrooms and green onion.  Stir-fry 1 - 2 minutes.  Remove vegetables from wok.        Add chicken to wok.  Stir-fry 2 - 3 minutes.  Add mushroom mixture and dressing mixture to wok.  Heat mixture through.        Place greens and bacon in a large salad bowl.  Pour hot mixture over greens and toss to coat.  Top with egg wedges.  Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Hungarian Goulash
recipes.directions: Melt butter.    Add beef, onion and garlic.    Add catsup, worcestershire sauce, sugar, salt, paprika, mustard and cayenne.    Add 1 1/2 cups of water.    Cover and simmer 2 hours.    Blend flour and 1/4 cup of water.    Add to meat.  Boil and stir.    Serve over noodles.

recipes.title: Meat Loaf with Mushrooms and Sour Cream
recipes.directions: Saute mushrooms in butter - 4 minutes.    Sprinkle with flour and nutmeg - Cook 1 minute.    Remove from heat and add sour cream.    Combine bread crumbs, catsup, eggs, w. sauce, beef, salt and pepper and mix well.    Spoon half of the mixture into pan.    Top with half of mushroom mixture.    Cover with remaining meat.    Bake at 350 for 45 minutes.        Thin remaining mushroom/sour cream mixture with milk, if necessary.

recipes.title: Mushroom-Stuffed Pork Chops with Escarole and Onion Sauce.
recipes.directions: Heat 2 tbs. oil and add mushrooms, carrots, garlic, shallots, and soy sauce.  Cover and cook over medium-low heat 3-4 minutes.      Stir in bread crumbs, butter, parsley, tarragon, salt, and pepper.      Remove from heat and let stuffing cool.    Divide stuffing among chops, firmly packing into pocket.      Coat each chop with flour.    Lightly coat skillet with oil and heat over medium-high heat.    Brown chops on both sides, 3-4 minutes.  Remove from pan.    Add broth and cook over high heat until bubbling.  Stir in onion.  Return chops to pan and baste with sauce.  Sprinkle generously with salt and pepper.  Add bay leaf and clove.      Cover with foil and place in oven.    Braise for 45 minutes.    Stir in escarole and cook 30 minutes more.    Transfer chops to platter.  Heat sauce over high heat and cook 1-2 minutes to reduce and thicken sauce.  Remove bay leaf.

recipes.title: Peanut Sate
recipes.directions: Cut beef into 1 1/2 0x22 pieces.  Place in a plastic bag in a large bowl.    For marinade, in a food processor bowl place onion, 2 tbs. soy sauce, lime juice, sugar, cumin, and garlic.  Cover and process till smooth.  Pour marinade over meat in bag.  Close bag and refrigerate for 4 hours, turning bag occasionally.  Drain meat, reserving marinade.    For sauce, in a pan stir broth into peanut butter.  Stir in molasses, 1 tsp. soy sauce, red pepper, and garlic.  Cook and stir until heated through.  Keep warm.    Thread meat onto skewers.  Broil 3 -40x22 from heat for 7 - 9 minutes or to desired doneness, turning occasionally and brushing with marinade.  Serve sauce with meat for dipping.        Calories per serving :  222    Fat :  11g        5 points

recipes.title: Pork and Apple Stir-Fry
recipes.directions: For sauce :  Stir together the apple juice, cornstarch, bouillon, and cinnamon.  Set aside.        Add oil to wok.  Add half the pork and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes.  Remove from wok and repeat with remaining pork.          Return all pork to wok.  Push meat from center of wok.  Stir sauce and add to center of wok.  Cook and stir until thickened and bubbly.        Add apples, green onions, and raisins.  Toss together and cook for 1 minute more.  Serve with rice.

recipes.title: Pork Chop Barbecue
recipes.directions: In a small saucepan combine all ingredients, except pork chops, and bring to boiling.  Add mixture and pork chops to crock pot.

recipes.title: Pork Chop Casserole
recipes.directions: Mix 2 tbs. flour with 1/2 tsp. salt.    Coat pork chops with flour mixture.    In 2 tbs. oil, brown chops and remove from pan.    Add 1 tbs. oil and cook onions and 1/2 tsp. salt.    Add apple-cranberry juice and 1 tbs. flour.    Arrange potatoes in a 9x13 pan and sprinkle with salt.    Top with onions and juice.    Tuck pork chops and apples into onions.    Cover with foil and bake at 350 for 1 hour.    Brush pork with apple jelly and bake, covered, 30 minutes more.

recipes.title: Pork Chops and Mushrooms in Mustard Cream Sauce
recipes.directions: Sprinkle pork chops with flour.    Heat oil over high heat.    Brown chops on both sides, 3-4 minutes.  Transfer to a platter.    Reduce heat to medium and add more oil if necessary.    Add mushrooms, shallot, and garlic, cover and cook over medium heat until mushrooms release their liquid, 3-4 minutes.  %5C    Stir in broth, salt, and pepper.    When liquid begins to bubble, add pork chops and baste well.    Cover pan and braise in oven at 325 degrees until chops are tender, about 1 1/4 hours.  Transfer chops to platter.      Add sour cream and mustard to pan.  Whisk over medium heat until sauce is blended and hot,  do not boil.

recipes.title: Pork Chops in Plum Sauce
recipes.directions: Blend together applesauce and spices.  Add vinegar, juices, honey, horseradish, and plums.  Blend well and set aside.    Season pork chops with salt and pepper.    Heat oil over high heat.  Brown chops well on both sides.  Transfer to baking dish just large enough to hold them in a single layer.    Add 1 cup water to pan and deglaze over high heat.  Boil until water is reduced by half, 3-5 minutes.  Add applesauce mixture and stir until sauce comes to a boil.  Pour over chops.    Tightly cover and bake at 350 degrees for 1 1/4 hours.

recipes.title: Pork Chops Stuffed with Sun-Dried Tomatoes and Ham
recipes.directions: Heat oil and add sun-dried tomatoes, garlic, and shallot.  Cool 2-3 minutes.  Add prosciutto, butter, parsley, basil, and oregano.  Stir until butter melts.  Remove from heat.    Add bread crumbs and season with salt and pepper.      Divide stuffing among chops and pack into pocket.    Coat each chop with flour.    Add 2 tbs. oil to pan and heat over medium-high heat.  Brown chops on both sides, about 2 minutes.    Add 2 1/2 cups wine to pan and cook over high heat until bubbling.  Cover pan and bake in 325 degree oven for 1 1/4 hours.     Remove meat from pan.  Over high heat, whisk in tomato paste.  Simmer briskly for 2 minutes, until slightly thickened.

recipes.title: Pork Loin with Sweet Potatoes and Prunes
recipes.directions: Marinate pork, prunes, wine, Calvados, onion, garlic, sage, and cloves in plastic bag in refrigerator for 3-6 hours.    Add sweet potatoes to boiling water,  parboil for 5 minutes.  Drain thoroughly.  Arrange in roasting pan.    Remove pork from marinade and pat dry.  Reserve marinade.  Slice evenly halfway into center so that meat opens like a book.    Transfer prunes to a mixing bowl.  Blend with parsley, sage, cayenne, and shallots.  Stuff roast with mixture.  Close roast with a few skewers and tie with string at 30x22 intervals.    Heat oil over high heat.  Sear pork on all sides, about 10 minutes total.    Place meat, slit side up, over sweet potatoes.  Pour marinade over meat.  Season generously with salt and pepper.  Add 1/2 cup broth.  Tightly cover and roast at 325 degrees for 1 1/4 hours.    Slice pork into 1/20x22 slices and serve with pan juices.

recipes.title: Prosciutto and Goat Cheese Timbales with Greens
recipes.directions: Line six 2/3 cup ramekins with plastic wrap, leaving overhang.    Line each ramekin with 2 slices of prosciutto, overlapping in center and patching any holes with extra prosciutto.  Mix goat cheese, cream cheese, and 1/4 cup green onions.  Season with pepper.      Divide equally into 6 ramekins.  Fold prosciutto to close, then fold plastic.  Press to compress.  Refrigerate overnight.        Invert ramekins to release timbales.  Peel plastic.  Heat 1 tbs. oil over medium heat.  Add timbales bottom side down.  Cover and cook about 5 minutes.  Transfer to plate,  let stand to set up.        Combine vinegar, and shallots in small bowl.  Slowly whisk in 1/2 cup oil.  Season with salt and pepper.        Combine greens, onions, and dressing in large bowl and toss.    Divide salad on plates and top with timbale.  Drizzle remaining dressin on top.

recipes.title: Roast Beef Wellington
recipes.directions: Melt butter.  Add mushrooms and parsley.  Saute 3-4 minutes.  Let cool and drain.    Toss cheese, beef, horseradish and mushroom mixture.    Divide into 6 portions.    Spoon 1 portion of filling in center of pastry.  Fold up corners of pastry pinching to seal.    DO NOT COMPRESS THE FILLING.    Place on greased baking sheet seam side down.    Bake at 425 for 25 - 30 minutes.

recipes.title: Spare Ribs Cantonese
recipes.directions: Place ribs, meaty side down, in pan.  Bake at 450 for 45 minutes.    Drain and turn ribs.    Lower heat to 350 and cook 45 minutes more.    Drain.    Mix remaining ingredients and pour over ribs.    Cook 30 minutes more, basting frequently.

recipes.title: Stir Fry Sweet Potatoes and Pork
recipes.directions: Combine brown sugar, cornstarch, soy sauce, sherry, ginger and water.    Season pork with pepper.    Heat 2 tbs. oil.  Stir fry pork for 5 minutes.    Remove meat.    Add sweet potatoes and pepper.  Stir fry for 2 minutes.    Return pork.    Add snow peas,  sauce and scallions.

recipes.title: Stuffed Braciole
recipes.directions: Combine grated cheese, bread crumbs, egg, 1 clove chopped garlic and olive oil.    Pound steak to 1/2 inch rectangle.    Rub meat with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.    Layer with ham, salami, mortadella and provolone, leaving a 1/2 inch border.  Spread with bread crumb mixture.    Roll up jelly roll style to enclose the filling and tie.    Cook bacon over medium heat until fat is rendered.    Add the 2 cloves of smashed garlic and cook until softened.    Remove onions and garlic and brown meat on all sides.    Add the wine and cook until reduced by half, about 10 minutes.    Add tomatoes and onion-bacon mixture.    Cover and simmer until cooked through, about 1 hour.    Transfer to a platter and let stand for 15 minutes.    Remove string and thinly slice.    Serve with sauce and grated cheese.

recipes.title: Teriyaki Pork Roast
recipes.directions: Combine first 7 ingredients in crock pot.    Add roast.    Cover and cook on low for 7-8 hours or until thermometer reads 160 degrees.    Thicken gravy.

recipes.title: Spice Muffins
recipes.directions: Mix all ingredients.    Divide into 24 muffins.    Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes.

recipes.title: Eggplant Lasagna
recipes.directions: Pare and slice eggplant crosswise into 1/40x22 slices.  Steam eggplant on rack over simmering water until very tender,  set aside on paper towels to drain.    In small bowl combine ricotta, 2 oz. mozzarella, egg white, parlsey, and garlic powder until well blended.    Spray an 80x22 square pan with cooking spray.    Cut lasagna noodles in half crosswise.    Arrange 1/3 of lasagna noodles in pan,  layer with 1/3 of ricotta mixture, eggplant slices, and crushed tomatoes.  Repeat layering twice,  sprinkle remaining mozzarella on top.    Bake at 350 for 20 - 25 minutes until heated through and cheese is lightly browned.        Per serving :  246 calories, 9g fat        Each serving provides :  1 protein, 3/4 vegetables, 1 bread, 5 opt. cal.

recipes.title: Linguine with Scallops
recipes.directions: Heat butter and oil over medium-high heat.  Add scallops,  cook and stir about 2 minutes or until opaque.  Remove scallops with slotted spoon leaving juices in pan.    Stir broth, vermouth or white wine, and lemon juice into pan.  Bring to boiling.  Boil for 10 - 12 minutes or until liquid is reduce to about 1 cup.  Stir in onion, parsley, dill, and pepper.  Reduce heat and simmer uncovered, for 1 minute.  Add scallops, stirring just until heated through.  Pour over linguine and toss gently.      Calories per serving :  362    Fat :  4g

recipes.title: Manicotti Shells
recipes.directions: Mix all ingredients in a blender of food processor.    (Mixture will be thin.)    Rub 60x22 pan with olive oil and heat over medium - medium high heat.    Tilt pan and pour 1/4 cup of batter into pan.    Tilt pan to form a circle.    When batter is set, turn pasta but do not brown.    Remove and cool.    Makes 12-14 manicotti shells.

recipes.title: Pasta Primavera
recipes.directions: In a frying pan, cook the first 5 ingredients.    Add tomatoes, salt and pepper and cook for 10 minutes.    Add the remaining ingredients and cook until heated through.

recipes.title: Scallops with Green Pesto
recipes.directions: To prepare pesto : In blender, combine scallions, parsley, basil, cheese, garlic, and oil until just blended, set aside.    In large skillet, bring 1 cup water to a boil,  add scallops.  Reduce heat to medium and cook, stirring occasionally, until scallops just turn opaque, about 3 minutes.    With slotted spoon, transfer scallops to large serving bowl,  reserve liquid.  Add remaining ingredients, pesto, and 1/2 cup reserved liquid.  Toss well to combine.  Serve immediately.        Per serving :  294 calories        Each serving provides :    1 1/2 fats, 1 1/2 proteins, 1 1/2 breads, 1/2 vegetable, 30 optional calories

recipes.title: Spaghetti Pie
recipes.directions: In medium bowl combine all ingredients for crust.  Spray a 90x22 pie plate with Pam.  Spread spaghetti mixture over bottom and up sides of plate.    Spread ricotta over crust and set aside.    Heat butter and saute onion, pepper, and garlic.    Add beef and tomato puree.  Spoon mixture over ricotta cheese.    Bake at 350 for 20 - 25 minutes.  Sprinkle with mozzarella and bake 5 minutes more.         Each serving provides :  3 proteins, 1 bread, 1 vegetable, 1 1/2 fats,                                    20 optional calories

recipes.title: Apricot Poppy Chicken
recipes.directions: Season chicken with salt and pepper.    Heat oil and cook chicken until browned.    Add shallots and cook for 3 minutes.    Add the vinegar and cook until slightly reduced, about 1 minute.    Add the chicken broth, apricot preserves, honey and poppy seeds and simmer over medium-low heat, stirring.    Stir in 1 tablespoon of butter..    Add salt and pepper to taste.

recipes.title: Chicken and Rice Salad
recipes.directions: Mix all ingredients and serve chilled.

recipes.title: Chicken and Zucchini in Mustard Sauce
recipes.directions: For sauce, in  a small bowl stir together yogurt and mustard.  Set aside.    Spray skillet with nonstick spray coating.  Heat over medium-high heat.  Stir-fry carrot and garlic 1 minute.  Add zucchini,  stir-fry about 3 minutes more or until vegetables are crisp-tender.  Remove from pan.    Add oil.  Stir-fry chicken for 2 - 3 minutes or until no longer pink.  Return vegetables to pan.  Add sauce to pan,  toss to coat all ingredients with sauce.  Cook and stir for 1 minute or until heated through.        Per serving :  218 calories, 8g fat        5 points

recipes.title: Chicken Marsala
recipes.directions: Season chicken with salt and pepper and dip in flour.    Melt 2 tbs.butter with oil.    Add chicken when foam subsides.    Brown 3 min. on each side.    Transfer chicken to plate.    Add wine and broth and bring to boil.    Return chicken to pan.    Cover and simmer 10 - 15 minutes basting occasionally.

recipes.title: Chicken Salad in the Tropics
recipes.directions: Whisk orange juice, pineapple juice, lime juice, soy sauce, olive oil, vegetable oil, honey and pepper.    Divide the salad greens on plates. Top with fruit, beans, cheese and chicken.      Sprinkle with dressing.

recipes.title: Chicken with Apples
recipes.directions: Season chicken with salt, pepper and garlic powder.    Dredge in flour.    Saute chicken in butter.    Flambe in brandy.  Remove and keep warm.    Put apples in pan.    Add cream, dry mustard, salt and pepper and reduce to 1 cup.    Add chicken and turn to coat.    Sprinkle with almonds.

recipes.title: Creamy Parmesan Chicken
recipes.directions: Combine bread crumbs, parmesan cheese, oregano, pepper and garlic powder.    Dip chicken in mixture.    Arrange skin-side-up in glass baking dish.    Microwave-bake at 425 for 20 minutes.    Combine soup, milk and sour cream and spoon over chicken.    Sprinkle with parmesan cheese.    Microwave-bake 5 - 10 minutes more.

recipes.title: Crunchy Baked Chicken
recipes.directions: Combine cornflakes, sesame seeds, salt and pepper.    Brush chicken with milk and coat with cornflake mixture.    Dot with margarine.    Bake at 400 for 15 minutes.

recipes.title: Sesame Chicken
recipes.directions: Beat egg.  Add chicken strips.  Stir in cornstarch.    Fry chicken in oil.    For the sauce, heat oil over medium heat.  Stir in remaining ingredients.  Boil sauce until just beginning to caramelize (1-2 min.)    Add chicken and toss to coat.  Sprinkle with 2 tbs. of sesame seeds and green onions.

recipes.title: Spicy Stir-Fry Peanut Chicken
recipes.directions: Cut chicken into 1 inch chunks and toss with cornstarch.    Stir fry chicken in 1 1/2 tbs. of oil until lightly browned.(3 min.) Remove and reserve.    Add the remaining oil and stir-fry onion about 45 seconds.  Add the red bell pepper and cook 30 seconds more.  Add the crushed red pepper and cook 5 seconds more.    Add the lemon juice, soy sauce, peanut butter and sugar.  Add the chicken broth gradually, stirring constantly until the sauce is smooth. Return the chicken and heat through.    Stir in the peanuts, scallions, and garlic.    Serve with rice.

recipes.title: Stuffed Chicken Rolls
recipes.directions: Heat butter and cook onion and garlic.      Add mushrooms, spinach, cheese, bread crumbs, salt, and pepper.    Set aside and cool.    Spread mixture on chicken, leaving 10x22 border on all sides.    Roll chicken lengthwise and secure with skewers.    Put in pan.    Add wine and chicken broth.    Cover pan with foil and bake for 40 minutes at 350 degrees.    Remove foil and continue baking for 10 - 15 minutes more.    In a small saucepan combine water and cornstarch and thicken gravy.    Pour over chicken and serve.        Each serving provides :  3 proteins, 1 1/4 veg., 1/2 fat,     221 calories

recipes.title: Tarragon Chicken
recipes.directions: Brown chicken.    Add onion, garlic, tomatoes, vinegar, tarragon, mustard, salt and pepper to frying pan.     Cook slowly.    Add heavy cream and flour just before serving.

recipes.title: Debby's Sweet and Sour Dressing
recipes.directions: Mix all ingredients.

recipes.title: Honey-Mustard Dressing
recipes.directions: Combine all ingredients in a jar and shake until blended.    Chill for 30 minutes before serving.        Calories per serving :  69    Fat :  2g

recipes.title: Lemon Vinaigrette
recipes.directions: Whisk together lemon juice and zest, vinegar, and mustard.    Slowly whisk in the olive oil.    Season with salt and pepper.

recipes.title: Olive Oil Dressing
recipes.directions: Whisk together vinegar, mustard, and lemon juice.    Add the olive oil in a slow, steady stream while whisking.    Add parsley, salt, and pepper.

recipes.title: Poppy Seed Dressing
recipes.directions: Mix all ingredients in food processor for 10 minutes

recipes.title: Sweet and Sour Dressing
recipes.directions: Combine all ingredients.

recipes.title: The Trellis Vinaigrette
recipes.directions: Whisk together vinegar, lemon juice, mustard, salt, and pepper.    Add the oil in a slow, steady stream while whisking.     Cover with plastic wrap and set aside at room temperature, up to several hours, or refrigerate for several days.    If refrigerated, return the vinaigrette to room temperature and whisk thoroughly before serving.

recipes.title: Broccoli and Cauliflower Salad
recipes.directions: In small bowl combine yogurt, mayo, vinegar and celery seed.    Mix well and set aside.    In large bowl combine remaining ingredients.    Add yogurt mixture and toss well.         Makes 2 servings.    Each serving (about 1 3/4 cups) provides :    1/2 milk, 1 1/2 fats, 1/4 protein, 3 1/4 vegetables 1/2 fruit, 15 optional calories.        Per serving :  197 calories

recipes.title: Broccoli-Raisin Salad
recipes.directions: Combine broccoli, onion and raisins.    To make the dressing combine mayonnaise, sugar and vinegar and mix well.    Add dressing to salad mixture and toss well.    Add bacon just before serving.    Serve chilled.

recipes.title: Honey Chicken Stir-Fry Salad
recipes.directions: Whisk together honey and vinegar.    Heat a large frying pan.  When hot, add bacon and stir fry, about 3-4 minutes.  Drain bacon.    Wipe fat from pan.  Return pan to heat for 5 minutes, until very hot.    Place chicken in pan, season with salt and pepper, and stir fry until browned, about 2-3 minutes.    Add scallions and stir fry for 30 seconds.
