Add the honey and vinegar mixture and cook for 45 seconds.    Remove from heat and mix in bacon.      Place chicken on top of salad.        Use with Mustard Vinaigrette.

recipes.title: Honey Mustard Roasted Walnuts
recipes.directions: Heat butter over medium heat.  When butter is melted and hot, remove from heat, add honey and mustard, and whisk to combine.    Add the walnuts to the hot honey mustard mixture.    Evenly coat the walnuts.    Spread walnuts on a baking sheet.    Separate and spread the walnuts.    Bake at 325 degrees for 12 minutes.    Remove from oven and season with salt.      Cool the walnuts to room temperature.    Keep at room temperature in a tightly sealed plastic container.

recipes.title: Mandarin Salad
recipes.directions: Cook almonds and 1tbs. + 1 tsp. sugar over low heat.    Stir constantly until sugar is dissolved.    Spread on ungreased cookie sheet.    Combine remaining ingredients.

recipes.title: No Guilt Potato Salad
recipes.directions: Combine all ingredients, stirring to coat vegetables with dressing.        Makes 4 servings.    Per serving :  121 calories        Each serving provides :    1/4 vegetable, 1 bread, 25 optional calories

recipes.title: Spinach Salad
recipes.directions: For salad, in a large bowl place spinach, orange sections, onion, and water chestnuts.  Sprinkle with pepper.    For dressing, in jar combine orange juice, oil, honey, sesame seed, and mustard.  Cover and shake.  Pour dressing over salad.  Toss lightly.  Serve immediately.        Calories per serving :  141    Fat :  4g

recipes.title: Spud, Spinach and Bean Salad
recipes.directions: For dressing :  Combine 4 oz. beans, broth, oil, vinegar, garlic, salt, mustard, and pepper in food processor and puree.        In large salad bowl combine spinach, potatoes, onion, and the remaining beans.        Just before serving, pour dressing over salad and toss.            Each serving (2 Cups) :  3/4 fat, 3 1/4 veg., 1 protein,1/2 bread        181 calories, 4 gr. fat

recipes.title: Taco Salad
recipes.directions: Mix meat, vegetables and cheese.    Toss with Catalina dressing.    When ready to serve, mix in Doritos.    Taco sauce may be added.

recipes.title: Tex-Mex Salad
recipes.directions: In large bowl combine all ingredients except corn chips.    Toss well to coat with dressing.    Surround with corn chips just before serving.        Per serving :  315 calories        Each serving provides :    1/2 fat, 1/2 protein, 3 1/2 vegetables, 2 1/4, breads, 40 optional calories

recipes.title: Orange Sauce
recipes.directions: Heat sugar, cornstarch, orange juice and salt to boiling.    Remove from heat and add butter and vanilla.

recipes.title: Seafood Sauce
recipes.directions: Boil wine, vinegar, shallots, thyme, bay leaf and pepper until liquid is evaporated.      Add cream and boil until reduced by half.    Reduce heat to low and whisk in butter, 1 tbs. at a time.    Do not allow sauce to simmer,  it should not get hot enought to separate.     Add lemon juice, salt and pepper.    Keep warm by setting bowl in a larger pan of very warm water.

recipes.title: Arthur's Crabs
recipes.directions: Clean crabs.    Layer crabs with all the ingredients.  Top with beer and olive oil.    Cook for 45 minutes.    Halfway through, remove crabs and pour broth into bowl.  Return crabs to pot and pour broth over crabs.

recipes.title: Baked Crab and Broccoli
recipes.directions: Cook broccoli and drain.    Arrange broccoli and crabmeat in bottom of pan.    For sauce, cook mushrooms and garlic in butter for about 4 minutes. Stir in flour and 1/8 tsp. of pepper.  Stir in milk.  Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly,  remove from heat.  Stir in cheese until melted.  Spoon sauce over top of broccoli and crab.  Cover with foil and chill for 2 - 24 hours.    Bake, covered, at 400 for 20 25 minutes or until bubbly.      When ready to serve, sprinkle with parmesan cheese.        Calories per serving :  184    Fat :  8g

recipes.title: Baked Seafood au Gratin
recipes.directions: Lightly grease 9x130x22 baking dish.    Saute onion and pepper in 1/2 cup of butter.  Cook until tender.    Stir in 1/2 cup of flour and cook over medium heat for 10 minutes.    Add the crabmeat and stir well.  Press this mixture into bottom of baking dish and set aside.        In a large Dutch oven, bring the water to a boil.  Add shrimp, scallops, and flounder.  Simmer for 3 minutes.  Drain and reserve 1 cup of the cooking liquid and set the seafood aside.        Preheat oven to 350 degrees.        Melt remaining 1/2 cup butter over low heat.  Stir in the remaining 1/2 cup flour.  Cook and stir constantly for 1 minute.  Gradually add the milk plus the 1 cup reserved cooking liquid.  Raise heat to medium and cook, stirring constantly, until the mixture is thickened and bubbly.  Stir in the shredded Cheddar cheese, vinegar, and Worcestershire sauce, salt, pepper, and hot sauce.  Add the cooked seafood and stir gently.        Spoon the seafood mixture over the crabmeat crust and sprinkle with the Parmesan cheese.  Bake for 30 minutes or until lightly browned.  Serve immediately

recipes.title: Pina Colada Shrimp
recipes.directions: Mix flour, salt and ginger.    Coat shrimp with flour mixture.    Dip in pina colada mix.    Pat coconut onto shrimp.    Fry immediately.    Serve with warm marmelade or sweet and sour sauce.

recipes.title: Seafood Salad Sandwiches
recipes.directions: Combine the shrimp or crabmeat, tomato, cheese, celery, almonds, and green onions.  Stir in sour cream.  Cover and chill for several hours.

recipes.title: Shrimp Dip
recipes.directions: Heat sugar, water, vinegar and egg until sugar melts.    Add cream cheese and onion to heated mixture.    Add shrimp and mix well.    Chill.

recipes.title: Shrimp with Gorgonzola Sauce
recipes.directions: Coat shrimp with flour.    Melt butter over high heat.    Add shrimp and saute 1 minute.    Add brandy and cook 30 seconds.    Add milk, cheese and marjoram and boil, about 3 minutes.

recipes.title: South Seas Shrimp and Mango
recipes.directions: Combine mustard, olive oil, orange juice and hot sauce.    Pour over shrimp and marinate 20 minutes.    Grill or bake.

recipes.title: Spicy Baked Shrimp
recipes.directions: Combine all ingredients except shrimp in 9x130x22 pan.    Add shrimp and toss.    Refrigerate 1 hour.    Bake at 450 for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.

recipes.title: Szechwan Shrimp
recipes.directions: Stir together water, catsup, soy sauce, dry sherry, cornstarch, honey, red pepper, and ground ginger.  Set aside.    In a large skillet stir-fry onion, and garlic for 30 seconds.    Add shrimp.  Stir-fry 2 - 3 minutes.  Push shrimp to sides of skillet.  Stir catsup mixture into center of skillet.  Cook and stir until thickened and bubbly.  Cook and stir 2 minutes more.  Stir sauce and shrimp together.    Serve with hot rice.        Calories per serving :  155    Fat :  5g        5 points

recipes.title: Blue Cheese Mushrooms
recipes.directions: Mix oil, vinegar and cheese, using back of spoon to smooth the cheese.  Add the scallions, salt and pepper, and mix well.    Toss mushrooms into the cheese mixture and mix lightly.    Serve at once.    145 calories

recipes.title: Broccoli Casserole
recipes.directions: Melt butter.    Add onions.    Add flour and water.    Thicken and remove from heat.    Stir in cheese.    Add broccoli.    Fold in eggs.    Pour into 11/2 qt. casserole.    Bake at 350 for 30 min.

recipes.title: Brussel Sprouts and Carrots with Honey Mustard Sauce
recipes.directions: Score ends with X.    Cook carrots and brussel sprouts.    Combine butter, mustard, honey and mustard seed.    Season with salt and pepper.    Toss the dressing with vegetables and let it sit 15 minutes.    Serve at room temperature, cold, or reheat and serve hot.

recipes.title: Butternut Squash Fries
recipes.directions: Mix salt, cumin and chili powder.    Cut squash into 1/2 inch sticks.    Toss squash with olive oil and half of salt mixture.    Spread in a single layer on a foil-lined baking sheet.    Bake at 425 degrees for 35 minutes.    Stir together sour cream and maple syrup.    Sprinkle fries with additional salt, if needed.    Serve with maple cream.

recipes.title: Carrots in Cheese Sauce
recipes.directions: Boil carrots until tender.  Drain.    Saute onion in butter.  Add salt, pepper and 1/4 cup of flour.    Add milk and cheese        Bake at 325 for 20 minutes.

recipes.title: Cauliflower Mashed with Cheese
recipes.directions: Cook cauliflower. (It should be very soft.)    Puree in food processor with butter and cream.    Mix together sour cream and cream cheese.    Add cauliflower to cream cheese mixture and mix well.    Bake at 350 degrees until brown on top.

recipes.title: Corn Salad
recipes.directions: Combine sour cream, worcestershire sauce and salt.    Cut corn off the cob.    Add corn, peppers and onion to mixture.    Cover and refrigerate at least 2 hours.

recipes.title: Cucumber Salad
recipes.directions: Mix sugar, salt, celery seed, mustard seed and cider vinegar.    Pour over cucumber mixture.    Refrigerate 24 hours.

recipes.title: Cucumbers in Sour Cream
recipes.directions: Combine sour cream, vinegar, salt and pepper.    Pour over cucumbers and onions.

recipes.title: Eggplant Florentine
recipes.directions: Cut eggplant into 8 diagonal slices.    Dredge eggplant in breadcrumbs, coating both sides,  place on baking sheet.  Bake at 350 for 15 minutes,  turn and bake 15 minutes more, until tender.  Cool slightly.    Spray frying pan with nonstick spray.  Add onion and garlic.  Cook over medium-high heat until onion is translucent, about 3 minutes.  Add tomatoes, basil, oregano, and red and black pepper.  Bring to a boil,  reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer 15 minutes.  Set aside.    In medium bowl, combine remaining ingredients until thoroughly blended.  Spread 2 heaping tbs. of spinach mixture on each slice of eggplant and roll to enclose.    Pour half the sauce into 13x90x22 pan.  Arrange eggplant rolls seam side down,  pour remaining sauce over top.  Cover with aluminum foil and bake until heated through, about 25 minutes.        Per serving :  394 calories, 15g fat        Each serving provides :  2 1/2 proteins, 3 3/4 vegetables, 1 bread

recipes.title: Eggplant Rollatini
recipes.directions: Trim and peel eggplant.  Cut lengthwise into eight 1/40x22 slices.    Heat 2 tbs. oil over medium high heat.  Cook eggplant about 2 minutes on each side or until browned.  Drain on paper towels.        Pour small amount of sauce into baking dish.        Cut mozzarella into eight 3x1/20x22x1/20x22 spears.  Divide prosciutto among eggplant slices.  Place a spear of cheese at one end of eggplant slice.  Roll up each slice around the cheese.    Arrange eggplant slices, seam side down, on top of sauce.  Sprinkle with pepper.  Bake, uncovered, at 450 degrees for 8 - 10 minutes.        To serve, spoon additional sauce over eggplant and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.

recipes.title: Glazed Carrots
recipes.directions: Cook carrots until tender.  Drain.    Melt butter.    Stir in sugar.    Add carrots.    Cook uncovered for 15 minutes.

recipes.title: Glazed Onions with Raisins and Almonds
recipes.directions: Combine onions, sherry, raisins, honey, water, butter and thyme in large skillet.      Bring to boil over medium-high heat.      Reduce heat to very low,  cover and simmer until liquid evaporates and onions begin to caramelize, stirring often, about 45 minutes.      Season with salt and pepper.      Remove from heat.      Stir almonds and red wine vinegar into onions.      Add a few teaspoons of water if mixture is too dry.  Serve warm.

recipes.title: Green Bean Casserole
recipes.directions: Stir soup, milk, soy sauce, pepper, beans and 1 1/3 cups onions in casserole.    Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes.    Stir.    Top with remaining onions and bake for 5 minutes more.

recipes.title: Green Bean Casserole with goat cheese
recipes.directions: Trim green beans and cook in small amount of boiling water for 3 minutes.    Mix 2 tablespoons olive oil and 2 tablespoons soy sauce or balsamic vinegar.  Add green beans, mushrooms and red pepper and toss to coat.      Roast vegetables at 375 degrees for 15 minutes.    Saute onions in olive oil.  While cooking, sprinkle with brown sugar.  Cook until onions are tender.    Put bread crumbs in plastic bag.  Add hot onions and shake bag to coat onions.    Mix cream cheese and goat cheese.      Place vegetables in casserole dish and add cheese.  (Scatter small chunks of cheese around casserole dish.)  Top casserole with onions.    Bake at 400 degrees for 10 minutes, just until heated through.

recipes.title: Green Beans with Blue Cheese
recipes.directions: Combine beans, peppers, salt and pepper in casserole.    Heat cream cheese and milk until melted.    Add blue cheese.    Thicken with corn starch.     Pour over vegetables.    Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes.

recipes.title: Marinated Vegetables
recipes.directions: Whisk together mustard, oil, vinegar, sugar, oregano, salt, pepper and sun-dried tomatoes.        Steam broccoli, cauliflower, green bean, and carrots until softened.        Mix marinade with steamed vegetables.  Add tomato and onion.        Chill at least 2 hours.

recipes.title: Mushrooms and Chestnuts in Cream
recipes.directions: Cut X in flat side of each chestnut.  Cook chestnuts in boiling water 10 minutes.      Remove from heat.  Using slotted spoon remove chestnuts from water 1 at a time.      Peel while still hot, removing tough outer shell and paper-thin brown skin.  Cut chestnuts in half.        Melt 1 1/2 tbs. butter with olive oil.      Add mushrooms and cook until golden brown, about 8 minutes.      Add sherry,  stir until evaporated.      Remove from heat and set aside.        Melt remaining 1 1/2 tbs. butter.  Add onion and cook until tender.    Add chestnuts, chicken broth and thyme and bring to simmer.      Cover and simmer until chestnuts are tender, about 10 minutes.      Transfer to pan with mushrooms.          Add cream to chestnut mixture,  simmer until slightly thickened, about 3 minutes.      Transfer to bowl and sprinkle with parsley.

recipes.title: Oven-Fried Zucchini
recipes.directions: On a shallow plate, combine all ingredients except zucchini and oil.    Slice off ends of zucchini.  Cut each zucchini lengthwise into quarters,  cut each quarter in half.  (into long, thin strips)    In large plastic bag, combine oil, zucchini, and 2 tsp. of water.  Close bag and shake well to moisten zucchini.  Dredge zucchini in bread crumb mixture.    Arrange in single layer on baking sheet.    Bake at 475 for 10 -12 minutes until golden.        Per serving :  115 calories        3 points        Each serving provides :  1 fat, 2 vegetables, 1/2 bread 15 optional calories

recipes.title: Potatoes Diablo
recipes.directions: In large skillet, heat oil,  add potatoes in a single layer.  Cook over medium-high heat until undersides are browned, about 4 minutes.  Turn potatoes and cook until browned, about 4 minutes more.    Transfer potatoes to baking pan.  Pour salsa evenly over top,  sprinkle with cheese.    Broil until cheese is melted, about 2 minutes.    Arrange olives over top and serve immediately.        Per serving :  275 calories        Each serving provides :  1 1/2 fats, 1 protein, 1 bread        6 points

recipes.title: Potatoes Provencale
recipes.directions: Cook onion in olive oil until softened.  Add garlic, sugar, tomatoes, bouillon cube, salt, and pepper.      Cook mixture, covered, stirring occasionally, 20 minutes.  Stir in olives.          Arrange one third of potatoes in baking dish.      Spread half of tomato mixture over potatoes and top with half of the cheese.      Continue layering, ending with potatoes.          Bake, covered, at 375 degrees for 40 minutes.      Remove foil and bake 20 - 30 minutes more.

recipes.title: Roasted Potatoes with Horseradish and Mustard
recipes.directions: Toss potatoes with 2 tbs. oil in large bowl.    Season with salt and pepper.    Spread potatoes on cookie sheet in single layer.    Roast until almost tender, about 30 minutes, at 400 degrees.    Combine horseradish, mustard and butter.    Spoon half of mixture over potatoes,  toss well.    Roast potatoes 15 minutes.    Toss potatoes with remaining mixture.    Roast until very tender, tossing occasionally, about 10 minutes.

recipes.title: Southwestern Bean Bake
recipes.directions: Cook bacon and drain.    Cook onion until soft.    Stir in ketchup, brown sugar, vinegar, mustard and cayenne.    Add all the beans and bacon and cook.

recipes.title: Spinach with Raisins and Pine Nuts
recipes.directions: Cover the raisins with boiling water.  Allow to stand for 15 minutes.    Drain the raisins and squeeze out as much water as possible.    Place the oil in a large pan over medium heat.    Add the garlic and heat for 2 - 3 minutes.    Add the raisins and pine nuts and cook for 1 more minute, stirring frequently because the pine nuts will burn easily.    Add the spinach while tossing and cook for about 3 minutes.    Season with salt.

recipes.title: Spinach with Tomatoes and Provolone
recipes.directions: Heat oil.    Add onion and garlic,  stir 2 minutes.    Add tomatoes,  simmer until onion is translucent and liquid evaporates, about 8 minutes.    Add spinach.    Toss until wilted, about 3 minutes.    Mix in cheese.  Cook until cheese just begins to melt, about 2 minutes.    Season with salt and pepper.

recipes.title: Spinach-Rice Casserole
recipes.directions: Cook rice with water.    Cook spinach and drain.  Squeeze out excess water.    Whisk eggs and milk.    In greased casserole, add rice, egg mixture, salt, butter, spinach, and cheese.      Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes to one hour.

recipes.title: Spinach-Stuffed Onions
recipes.source: BH and G New Dieter's Cookbook
recipes.directions: Bring 3 cups lightly salted water to boiling in a large pan.     Peel onions, halve crosswise, and add to pan.    Return to boiling and reduce heat.  Simmer, covered, about 20 minutes or till onions are just tender.      Drain and cool.    Remove centers of onions, leaving 1/4 - 1/2 inch thick shells.    Finely chop 1/4 cup of onion centers,  set aside.    Cook spinach and drain.  Stir in cream cheese till melted.             Add chopped onion, pimiento, bacon, and nutmeg.  Fill onion shells with spinach mixture.  Arrange onions in a baking dish.  Sprinkle with bread crumbs and melted butter.    Bake, covered, at 350 degrees for 15 minutes,  uncover and bake     5 - 10 minutes more or till heated through.

recipes.title: Stilton Potatoes
recipes.directions: Arrange 1/3 of potato slices in bottom of pan.    Sprinkle with half the cheese, salt and pepper.    Repeat layer, ending with potatoes on top.    Sprinkle with salt and pepper.    Pour small amount of broth into pan.    Dot with butter.    Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour and 40 minutes, until potatoes are golden brown.

recipes.title: Sweet Potato Casserole with Praline Topping
recipes.directions: Beat eggs and stir in potatoes.    Add remaining ingredients for potatoes and mix.    Spread in greased dish.        Mix brown sugar, flour and pecans.    Add butter and blend.    Sprinkle over potatoes.    Bake at 350 for 60 - 70 minutes.

recipes.title: Sweet Potato Puff
recipes.directions: Peel and cut sweet potatoes into 10x22 pieces.     Boil for 10 - 15 minutes.    Drain and mash until smooth.    Add orange juice, egg and cinnamon and mix well.    Bake at 375 degrees for 30 minutes.        Makes 10 servings    2 pts.

recipes.title: Sweet Potato Puff with Cornflake Topping
recipes.directions: Place sweet potatoes in bowl and mix for 30 seconds.    Add milk, sugar, eggs, butter, nutmeg and cinnamon.    Turn to speed 4 and beat for 1 minute.     Spread mixture in greased 9 inch pie plate.    Bake at 400 degrees for 20 minutes or until set.        Place all Crunchy Praline Topping ingredients in mixer bowl.      Turn to Stir Speed and mix about 15 seconds.    Spread on hot puff.    Bake 10 minutes longer.        6 servings.

recipes.title: Vegetable Scramble
recipes.directions: Cook egg substitute with vegetables.    Serve with English muffin.

recipes.title: Vegetarian Chili
recipes.directions: Heat oil.  Add pepper, onion and garlic.  Cover and cook over medium heat about 10 minutes.  Stir in undrained tomatoes, drained beans, raisins, vinegar, chili powder, parsley, sugar, basil, oregano, allspice, salt, and pepper.  Bring to boiling,  reduce heat.  Simmer, covered, for 1 1/2 hours.  Stir in beer.  Return to boiling,  simmer, uncovered, for 30 minutes more or to desired consistency.  Stir in cashews.  Sprinkle cheese on each serving.  Makes about 12 cups.        Per serving :    333 cal., 11 g total fat (2 g sat. fat)

recipes.title: Butternut Squash, Apple and Onion Medley
recipes.directions: Toss squash, apples and onions with olive oil to coat.    Season with salt and pepper.    Place in shallow baking pan.    Roast at 425 degrees for 15-20 minutes.    In a small saucepan, simmer sugar, vinegar and soy sauce until reduced by one-third.    Add butter a piece at a time and whisk.    Toss vegetables with dressing and serve.

recipes.title: Apple Broccoli Salad
recipes.directions: Prepare apples.    Stir into orange juice to keep from turning brown.    Combine with broccoli slaw and raisins.    Add yogurt and mix well.    Chill.        Makes 6 servings    1 point

recipes.title: Blizzard
recipes.directions: Mix all ingredients in food processor.        3 Pts.

recipes.title: Breakfast Couscous
recipes.directions: Bring water and milk to a boil.        Add remaining ingredients and mix.        Remove from heat.        Cover and let stand for 10 minutes.        3 servings - 4 pts.

recipes.title: Chocolate Pudding
recipes.directions: Bring milk, cocoa, sugar, cornstarch and salt to a  boil over medium-low heat, stirring constantly for 2 minutes.    Beat yolk.    Whisk in 1 tbs. of chocolate mixture.    Whisk the yolk back into the remaining chocolate mixture.    Cook over medium-low heat, stirring constantly, for 2 minutes.    Do not let mixture boil.    Remove from heat and add vanilla.        Serves 4    3 points

recipes.title: Cinnamon Dip
recipes.directions: Beat all ingredients until smooth.    Cover and refrigerate.

recipes.title: Jello Whip
recipes.directions: Mix jello and boiling water.    Add ice cubes and mix until ice is melted and jello is soft set.    Fold in Cool Whip.

recipes.title: Layered Strawberry Cheesecake Bowl
recipes.directions: Combine berries and Splenda and refrigerate until ready to use.    Beat cream cheese with mixer until creamy.    Gradually add milk.    Add pudding and mix well.    Blend in Cool Whip.    Spoon half of the pudding mix into bowl.    Top with cake and berries and remaining cheese mixture.    Refrigerate 24 hours.    Melt chocolate and drizzle over dessert.    Top with additional Cool Whip.

recipes.title: Pumpkin Spread
recipes.directions: Mix all ingredients and let stand 5 minutes.        One serving (2 tbs.) - 1 point

recipes.title: Venetian Peperonata
recipes.directions: Cut eggplant in 3/4 inch rounds.  Sprinkle with salt.  Let stand for 45 minutes.  Pat dry.  Cut into 3/4 inch cubes.    Heat oil with garlic over medium heat until brown.  Discard garlic.    Add onion, saute until golden.    Add eggplant, peppers and wine, cover and simmer for until peppers are tender (about 30 minutes)    Add tomatoes, increase heat to medium-high and saute uncovered until almost all liquid evaporates.      Season with salt and pepper.    Spoon over bread.  Sprinkle with gorgonzola.

recipes.title: Yello
recipes.directions: Mix boiling water and jello.    Add ice cubes and stir until ice is melted and jello is soft set.    Whisk in the yogurt and mix well.        Makes 6 servings, 1/2 pt. each

recipes.title: Apple Half-Moons
recipes.directions: Honey-Mustard Mayonnaise :    Combine all ingredients.  Can be refrigerated for 1 to 2 days.        Cut apples into wedges.    Place in a bowl and toss with lemon juice.    Cut ham into strips.    Spread mayonnaise on one side of ham strip.    Top with chives and apple and wrap ham around middle of apple.    The apples can be assembled 2 to 3 hours ahead.    Cover and refrigerate.

recipes.title: California Guacamole
recipes.directions: Coarsely mash avocados. (DO NOT PUREE)    Fold in remaining ingredients.    Guacamole is best made as close to serving as possible.    For short-term storage, seal in an airtight container with a piece of plastic wrap against the surface of the guacamole.

recipes.title: Italian Appetizer Bites
recipes.directions: Unroll one package of crescent rolls and line bottom of pan.  Pinch seams together.    Cover rolls with half of salami, ham, cheese and roasted peppers.  Beat together six eggs and parmesan and pour over appetizer.    Repeat layering and top with crescent rolls.    Beat remaining egg and brush over top.     Cover dish with aluminum foil.     Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.    Uncover and bake 30 more minutes.    Cool for one hour and cut into squares.

recipes.title: Buckeye bars
recipes.directions: Line an 80x22 square pan with foil, extending foil over sides.    Beat butter and peanut butter with mixer until blended.    Add wafer crumbs and mix well.    Gradually add sugar, mixing well after each addition.    Press onto the bottom of prepared pan.    Microwave frozen Cool Whip and chocolate on high 1 minute.    Stir and microwave 15-30 seconds more or until chocolate is melted.    Stir until blended.    Pour over peanut butter layer and spread to cover.    Refrigerate 2 hours.    Use foil handles to lift dessert from pan before cutting.

recipes.title: Oat and Toffee Grahams
recipes.directions: Line a 15x10 inch baking pan with foil.    Arrange graham crackers in a single layer in pan.    In a large bowl, combine oats, sugars and flour.    Stir in melted butter, egg and vanilla until well mixed.    Spoon over graham crackers and spread evenly to cover crackers.    Bake at 350 degrees for 20-25 minutes, until mixture bubbles and is lightly browned on top.    Remove from oven and sprinkle with chocolate chips.    Return to oven for 1 minute.    Spread melted chocolate over top to cover.    Sprinkle with almonds.    Cool and cut into 32 bars.

recipes.title: Kathy's Sloppy Joe
recipes.directions: Brown meat in olive oil on all sides.    Saute onions, peppers and garlic in olive oil.    Add remaining ingredients and heat.    Put mixture in crock pot with meat.    Cook for 6 - 8 hours.

recipes.title: Sausage Stuffing
recipes.directions: Cook onion and mushrooms in butter.    Remove from stove and put in large bowl.    Cook and crumble sausage.    Add to bowl with onion mixture.    Cook Stove Top Stuffing, following directions on box.    Mix stuffing with onion and sausage mixture.    Season with salt and pepper.    Bake at 350 degrees until heated.

recipes.title: Holiday Pecans
recipes.directions: Line a baking sheet with foil.        Stir together sugar, salt and cinnamon.        In a separate bowl, whisk egg white and 1 tbs. water until foamy.    Add pecans to bowl and stir until coated.    Pour in sugar mixture and melted butter.    Stir well until combined.        Spread pecan mixture in an even layer on baking sheet.    Bake at 300 degrees for 25 minutes, stirring occasionally.    Cool completely.

recipes.title: Thai Chicken Wings
recipes.directions: Line a cookie sheet with aluminum foil.    Toss wings with olive oil, salt and pepper.     Place on cookie sheet in a single layer.    Bake at 400 degrees for 50 minutes, until crispy and golden.    Using tongs, toss with Thai honey and spice sauce.        THAI HONEY and SPICE SAUCE :    Place all ingredients in bowl and stir well.

recipes.title: Shrimp with corn and bacon
recipes.directions: Cook onion with oil for 4-6 minutes.    Add wine and cook until reduced by half, 2-3 minutes    Add cream and bring to a boil.    Stir in shrimp and corn.    Simmer 4-6 minutes.    Stir in bacon and serve over rice.

recipes.title: Artichoke, Potato and Mushroom Casserole
recipes.directions: Arrange half of potatoes in baking dish, covering bottom completely.    Top with half of artichoke hearts and half of mushrooms.    Crumble half of goat cheese over vegetables.    Sprinkle with salt, pepper, half of garlic and half of parmesan cheese.    Drizzle with olive oil.    Cover with remaining artichoke hearts, goat cheese, garlic, parmesan.    Top with remaining potatoes.    Pour wine over vegetables.    Drizzle with olive oil.    Cover dish with aluminum foil.    Bake at 425 degrees for 40 minutes.    Uncover and bake 5 more minutes until potatoes are browned.

recipes.title: Ricotta Orange Pound Cake
recipes.directions: Combine flour, baking powder and salt.    Stir to blend.    Cream butter, ricotta and sugar until light and fluffy, about 3 minutes.    With the machine running, add eggs 1 at a time.    Add vanilla, orange zest and amaretto until combined.    Add the dry ingredients and mix just until incorporated.    Pour the batter into a greased loaf pan.    Bake at 350 degrees for 45 to 50 minutes, until cake pulls away from sides of pan.    Let cool and dust with confectioners sugar.

recipes.title: Sausage and Rice Timbale
recipes.directions: Cook rice, drain and let cool.    fMelt 2 tbs. butter and cook onion.    Add sausage and cook.      Add garlic and tomato paste.    Stir in chicken broth.    Cook 15-20 minutes.    Grease an 80x22 square baking pan and sprinkle with breadcrumbs.    Mix cooled rice with eggs and parmesan cheese.    Spread half of rice mixture over bottom of baking pan.    Top with provolone and meat mixture.    Cover with remaining rice mixture.    Bake at 450 degrees for 30 minutes.

recipes.title: Cranberry Shortbread Cookies
recipes.directions: Cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy.    Mix in flour, a little at a time.    Stir in craisins.    Roll batter into balls.    Place on ungreased cookie sheet and flatten with a glass dipped in sugar.    Bake at 325 degrees for 14-15 minutes.

recipes.title: Snickerdoodle Biscotti
recipes.directions: Mix flour, 1 cup sugar, baking powder and salt.    Mix oil, vanilla and 3 eggs together and add to flour mixture.    Turn dough onto floured surface and knead 7 or 8 times.    Divide in half.    Shape each portion into a roll 8 inches long and place six inches apart on cookie sheet lined w/parchment.    Flatten each roll to 1 inch thickness.    Brush tops of rolls with egg whte.    Combine 2 tbs. sugar and cinnamon and sprinkle over rolls.    Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.    Cool 15 minutes.    Cut into 1/2 inch slices and lay cut sides down on cookie sheet.    Reduce oven temperature to 325 degrees.    Bake 10 minutes more - 5 on each side.

recipes.title: Holiday Biscotti
recipes.directions: Mix flour and baking powder.    Using electric mixer, beat sugar, butter and salt to blend.    Beat in eggs, one at a time.    Add flour mixture and beat just until blended.    Stir in pistachios and cranberries.    Form dough into 13x30x22 log.    Place on cookie sheet lined w/parchment.    Bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes.    Cool for 30 minutes.    Cut into 1/20x22 slices and lay cut side down on cookie sheet.    Bake 15 minutes more.    Cool complete and spread with melted chocolate.

recipes.title: Sweet Potato Corn Chowder
recipes.directions: Fry bacon.  Drain and crumble.    Drain off bacon grease, keeping 1 tablespoon.    Add onions to bacon grease.    Add potatoes to the pot with enough chicken broth to cover potatoes.    Bring to simmer until potatoes are tender.    Puree with immersion blender.    Add brown sugar, corn, scallions, cream, salt and pepper.

recipes.title: Mexican Soup
recipes.directions: Heat oil and cook onion for 3 minutes.    Add sweet potatoes, chicken broth and cumin.    Cover and reduce heat.    Simmer until potatoes are tender.    Process soup with immersion blender.    Stir in corn, salsa, diced tomatoes and black beans.    Simmer to blend flavors.    Serve with sour cream.

recipes.title: Nilla Turtle Cookie Balls
recipes.directions: Mix cream cheese, Nilla wafers and caramel topping in food processor.    Shape into 42 (1 inch) balls.    Freeze for 10 minutes.    Melt chocolate.    Dip balls in chocolate and place on waxed paper.    Refrigerate.

recipes.title: Sausage Balls
recipes.directions: Combine all ingredients for sausage balls and mix until crumbly.    Form into 10x22 balls, squeezing until mixture holds together.    Place balls on baking sheet.    Bake at 375 degrees for 18 to 20 minutes.    Mix ingredients for dip and serve with sausage balls.        Makes 60 sausage balls.

recipes.title: Snickerdoodle Muffins
recipes.directions: Cinnamon crumble :    Mix sugar, flour and cinnamon.    Mash in 1/2 stick of softened butter.        Mix flour, baking powder, cinnamon, salt and baking soda.    In separate bowl whisk eggs, sugar, butter, sour cream and vanilla.    Fold into dry ingredients.    Stir 1/2 cup of cinnamon crumble into batter.    Divide among muffin cups and top with remaining cinnamon crumble.    Bake at 350 degrees for 25 to 28 minutes.

recipes.title: Fig and Blue Cheese Tarts
recipes.directions: Mix cream cheese and blue cheese until well blended.    Stir marmalade and vinegar over low heat and add figs.    Cook over low heat for 5 to 7 minutes.    Remove crescent rolls from package but do not unroll.    Cut roll into 16 slices.    Press center of each slice to make indentation.    Place blue cheese mixture in indentation and top with fig mixture.    Bake at 350 degrees for 15 to 19 minutes.

recipes.title: Rib marinade
recipes.directions: Wrap ribs in aluminum foil.    Bake at 325 degrees for 2 to 3 hours.
